Reviews.Title: “Great Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulytrip
Reviews.Content: Perfect neighborhood. Near amazing restaurants: L'Arpege, Auguste, Sac a Dos, etc.. close walking to Musees Rodin, D'Orsay, L'Orangerie, Invalides, etc... close to Champs D'Elysees, etc..Also close to St. German, Bon Marche. small, but French. Nice bathrooms. all in all a great value/gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and perfect comfort”
Reviews.Author: philip b
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Hotel de Varenne and regreted not to stay longer. We paid only 159 € for a nice double room with bath on the garden side, which seems to be really reasonable for Paris. The comfort was perfect : nice decoration, freshly renovated room, excellent bed, very cleaned bathroom. The location is excellent and we enjoyed very much the atmosphere of Rue de Bourgogne. Nice little shops and very good restaurants. We had dinner at Auguste, the food is excellent and the service efficient. This hotel is a very good choice for a short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wi-fi but pricy considering room's and bed's quality”
Reviews.Author: AntonioNegro
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at Hotel de Varenne in Paris and I just loved the great location. It is just 20 mins walking distance from major city attraccion. I also appreciated the free and high speed internet connection which is always a plus to me. I did not have a chance to try the breakfast since I found the reservation price already "good enough" for my taste and I wanted to explore some caffeterias anyway and taste some genuine french croissants. The room was clean even though a bit too small (someone may say cozy but really would be a nice way to put it). The most disappointing finding was the mattress that seemed to me ready to be changed for a new one. Eventually I had a not soo good night sleep and that as you may imagine did not help much during the day. About price and value I had a previous experience in Paris and I was also warned about the average hotel quality there but I still believe that basic stuff like a good and comfortable bed is a fundamental right for an hotel's customer.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 23-27, 2012”
Reviews.Author: rr177
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The rooms were bigger than I expected, although they are not large by American hotel standards. My room was on the second floor overlooking the courtyard. The hotel is in an excellent location, just minutes away from Invalidas (Napolean's tomb) and the Eiffel Tower. I didn't eat at the hotel because there is an excellent little bakery just a few minutes walk away at the beginning of Rue de Clare (a very charming street filled with sidewalk shops). You have to try their croissant amonde.There is also a Starbucks at the end of Rue de Clare :). Having free wifi at the hotel was also a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: susan w
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect and we enjoyed every minute of it. Everything has been said already and it's all true ! What can we add ? May that the owner himself is at the front desk in the morning. This is definitely a good way to treat guests. I was about to forget to mention that the "omelette" is the best I ever ate. My husband and I will be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and charming”
Reviews.Author: harvey g
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel with great location on the left bank. Fantastic staff, very helpful and smiling. We enjoyed our stay and don't regret our choice. We had room 28 located on the garden side. This is very quiet with a nice and french classical decoration. This is what we expected and we haven't been diappointed. As aleady mentioned the bed's extremely comfy. We won't hesitate to go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: james b
Reviews.Content: Hotel Varenne is a real treasure. Don't hesitate, go ahead and book it. We experienced a very pleasant stay with my girlfriend. Spent there 4 nites and wish we couls have stayed longer. Staff is courteous and willing to please and help. Our room was a little cocoon and we enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: nhelixon
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Varenne has made our stay in Paris even more enjoyable. The rooms and bathroom are very clean and beautiful. The outside and inside of the hotel is very Parisienne. The front desk personnel is formal, but very curteous. The hotel offers breakfast for additonal 10 Euros. We opted out of breakfast and instead dined on lovely croissant and cafe latte in the bakery just down the street from the hotel. The hotel's locations is perfect. 5 minutes from the Metro, 5 minutes from the Rodin Museum and 10 minutes from Napoleon's tomb and Military Museum. Eiffel Tower is only 20 minute walk away. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Paris. It might not be ideal for families with small children. Another plus are two grocery stores just across the street from the hotel where you can get your water and snacks. Another great plus is a small hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurant - Lotus Blanc,up the street from the hotel. Try it and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location and super service”
Reviews.Author: robert v
Reviews.Content: Yes we enjoyed it. We did not hesitate a long time when we read all these good reviews. This was definitely great choice. The location, near Musee Rodin is fantastic. We found many treasure addresses in the area following the advices of the reception staff. Our room was quiet, clean and we loved the "old fashion" decoration. The comfort of the bed is second to none. The real plus of this hotel is the kindness of the entire staff, particularly at the reception. Before our check out they proposed to print our boarding passes ! We loved and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant holidays”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: We experienced a very pleasant week in Paris, coming from Brasil for holidays in France. Everybody speaks english which seems to be unusual in Paris, this helped us a lot The staff is very professional and friendly, always willing to please. Our rooms were comfortable, freshly renovated and very quiet. The value is very good too. The location is excellent. Close to everything and away from the noise of the city. We will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rhiannon W
Reviews.Content: I normally am use to traveling at really nice 5 star resorts with my family..however, since this last trip to Paris was on my budget plan I had to downgrade. I have seen some hotels at this price that are pretty bad, but this hotel was nice. It's not some huge luxurious hotel don't get me wrong, but it's pretty and clean and safe. It's in a good area. Not dangerous but not too pricey. You can run to Eiffel Tower as well as Le Louvre. There is also a fabulous patisserie a few doors down to the left and a 1 Michelin Star restaurant two doors to the right. You are close to St. Germain, which has great shops and restaurants. The hotel didn't have room service or a stocked mini-bar and you could not order movies which kind of was a bummer. But if you don't plan on spending a ton of time at your hotel it's a good place to rest. It was very clean. I would definitely suggest it to others. :)

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Joeyjojo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in feb. good location, breakfasts were a little bit overpriced but what you would expect. Had a lovely stay until the 2nd day - had builders drilling outside our room for over an hour, very noisy and we had been out all day so wanted to rest. Upon calling reception I was hung up on twice which to me is appalling customer service. Nice little hotel apart from the drilling and banging

Reviews.Title: “charming small french hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: NYerLondon
Reviews.Content: great location for walkers. 1 block from rodin, 5 min from D'orsay, and just over the bridge to louvre, opera, place de madeline etc. We also enjoyed walking to st germain on sundays where restaurants are actually open. Hotel is typically french, but with very pleasant english-speaking staff. The decor is really old, but the rooms are nice and warm and the beds are surprisingly comfortable. Plus the cleaning staff doesn't harass you when you sleep in like in a big chain hotel (i chose this hotel after staying in le meridian all week for work). the walls are really thin so we could hear people leaving in the morning, but it was fine. it's a good value for the location. there's a small market, a fruit vendor and pharmacy on the street so very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: rick m
Reviews.Content: The positives reviews about this hotel helped us to choose the place to stay in Paris. We did not regret it as the value is excellent : only 159 Euro for a nice room with a spacious bathroom and freshly renovated. This was on the backside of the hotel, overlooking the garden, very quiet. As already mentioned the front desk staff is polite, friendly and english speaking. They gave us good tips about restaurants and directions to the main touristic places. We enjoyed the breakfasts too, served in our room every morning with a great smile. We will return without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Better and better”
Reviews.Author: brian p
Reviews.Content: Our first time there was in 2009 in we keep returning. Each time they improve their service and the comfort of the rooms. Beds have been changed for extremely comfortable ones and the rooms are renovated on a regular basis. The entire staff is friendly and wenow feel like home when we arrive in Paris. You can stay there, you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AthensADav
Reviews.Content: Actually, I would prefer to keep it as a secret, a hidden gem.... but I have to share it with travelers - friends who would like to stay in a cosy, comfortable, quiet, safe hotel in the center of Paris! The extra plus? The smiley staff of course, who is ready to do the extra mile for you. 139 Euros for a double room in Paris is a great deal! Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super quick and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Under_many_stars
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel due to the vast numbers of of positive review. And yes it is a really nice hotel with a ok balance between price and quality. Almost deserve another star. Location: Great for Paris, quiet but still with many good restaurants and shops in same street. Staff: Fastest check-in ever abroad for me. Just said my name and I was handed key and a welcome. I met 5-6 different people in the reception and they all appeared friendly and professional. Room: Perfect and exactly what is shown on pictures. Good bed. Generally: Its a small hotel. Dont look for gym, business center etc. But there is free wireless internet everywhere and a free desktop pc to borrow in breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: 32RLM13
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for New Year's Eve and stayed at the Hotel de Varenne. It is a small boutique hotel but it is in a great location. The rooms were clean and quite comfortable. The hotel is close to the Assemblee National building of France on the Left Bank. It is also close to the Louvre, Invalides, Tour Eiffel, The Rodin Museum (at the end of the block), Rue Cler, and many other sites. The neighborhood is quiet and even though we were there during the New Year's Eve celebration we were never bothered by street noise. There are some small local cafes nearby to eat but even though you are close to many attractions you do have to look for them due to the hotel being is such a quiet area. The front desk staff were outstanding. The were extemely friendly, all speaking English, and helpful. The helped us with anything we needed from incidentals in the hotel to making dinner reservations. There are two metro stations nearby so when you did want to travel outside the immediate area it was easy to do. I thought this hotel was a tremendous value for Paris, especially during the holiday period.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: FuryF
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Excellent location. Room was spotless & staff very friendly. Avoid the breakfast though (not worth it) - great bakery & supermarket next door. Overall, great value for money & highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant city break”
Reviews.Author: jane g
Reviews.Content: Agree with previous reviewer. We enjoyed very much our stay. Did not experience any problem with noisy neighbours. Would return with pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Good value small Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PNPathman
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant, well appointed hotel in a convenient location. We stayed for several nights and our daughters joined us for four nights. The rooms do vary in size and amenities. The breakfast was lovely, fresh and convenient. The reception staff assisted with various bookings and arrangements including an excellent recommendation for a celebration dinner. We would stay in the Hotel de Varenne again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples, not so great for families.”
Reviews.Author: mgpepper
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the hotel although I have to say that they are not really family friendly. The elevator does not accommodate a stroller, and most rooms are too small to put a "pack-n-play" into as a bed for a kiddo or two. The only room that we found was Room #27 which has the beautiful view of the courtyard and is spacious enough to accommodate the kid bed and has some space for movement and play. The hotel is located in the Embassy and Ministry quarter so it is very quiet and safe, plus it is very close to the Army Museum where, apparently, Napoleon's Tomb is located. There are plenty of restaurants, our favorite is La Square http://www.restaurant-lesquare.com/, and there are even a couple of grocery stores right across the street if you want to buy milk for the little one or some snacks (and diapers as we found out). The downside of the location is the fact that the subway is not kiddo friendly as well. The Varenne and the Asemblee Nationale Metro stations are very small, require two people to carry the stroller up and down the stairs (no escalator or elevator) and the entrance into the stations takes a well coordinated ballet of having one person go in and then activate the exit gates so the other person with a stroller can come in. Is it a great place with a great service and a very good location that is the safest place in Paris... DEFINITELY... but I would have chosen a better hotel that was a bit better located and easier to get around if I had known these downsides. All in all, if you are traveling sans kids, this is a great place to stay... with kids, especially small ones, I'd suggest finding a different place, even if it means spending more money. Also, quite the disappointment for us, it is a "four star" hotel without a swimming pool or any kind of recreational/relaxation facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in heaven”
Reviews.Author: william l
Reviews.Content: A perfect little retreat in the center of Paris. We spent four nights there and enjoyed every moment of our stay. The staff is really willing to please and help, giving very good advices for visits and restaurants. As already mentioned the comfort of the rooms is excellent. The location is second to none, near Rodin Museum. We had a memorable crhistmas time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: juan d
Reviews.Content: Nothing to add to previous reviews just mention that the service is perfect and the comfort of the rooms surprising for a 3 stars hotel. Beds are really high class and extremely comfortable. The staff is polite, fluent in english and always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “excellant location”
Reviews.Author: bluelightning
Reviews.Content: Our cozy room was quiet, overlooking a courtyard, so I saw trees rather than traffic. The room was clean and there was a small refrigerator. My only complaint is that there was no clock in the room. Staff was very helpful and fluent in English. I easily walked to many of the "tourist"sites in Paris. Note I enjoy walking. Metro and RER locations were nearby. It was easy to take RER to CDG airport - about a 6 block walk to the station. Free wireless internet was great.

Reviews.Title: “Location NÂ° 1”
Reviews.Author: mark g
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in Paris. In the middle of the seventh district, this is the very center of the city and you could believe you stay in the countryside. This is so quiet and peaceful that you ear the birds singing in the morning. Staff is courteous, friendly and helpful. Would return with pleasure

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in good alction for short stay”
Reviews.Author: zxr1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in room 11 and had a wonderful time. The hotel is in an ideal location within walking distance of many of Paris' sites. The metro is a 5 minute walk away. There are some nice restaurants and shops close by. It sits in the middle of many of the Embassies and French Government buildings. The hotel staff were all helpful and spoke English. Our room was large and comfortable. Would definitely stay there again. The breakfast is basic and there is no bar but don't let that put you off as the local bars and restaurants more than make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Canucks_from_Calgary
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in this lovely little hotel. We hopped off the metro and found the hotel in no time flat as it's really quite conveniently located. Our room was a standard double, which was perfect for us. Just enough space, a comfortable bed, and a nice shower. We had a room that overlooked the courtyard, which was actually very quiet. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but instead opted for picking up a bite at one of the two grocery stores across the street, or the fresh fruit vendor right by the hotel. We also asked for a dinner recommendation one night and ended up at this lovely little restaurant a couple blocks away. I can't remember what it was called, but the food was quite enjoyable. I found the neighbourhood was a little bit tough to find restaurants in unless you had plenty of time to wander, so you were much better off if you asked for some advice before heading out to eat. The staff were quite friendly and more than willing to help. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: fammay
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hotel de Varenne last July; we had a total of three rooms, two singles and a standard double. We got a good price for them via the web. The hotel is, as others have noted, well run and in a quiet location, especially appreciated in high tourist season. I have two fairly minor negative comments, however. One is that on two of our four mornings the coffee was undrinkable. I've never before been served such terrible coffee in a French hotel. The other and more serious deficiency was that, in our (small) standard double, the toilet was located on one side of the room, and the sink/shower on the other. The single rooms were actually more practical and had more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: ben l
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with previous reviewer. This was the best choice we did to stay at the Varenne. Friendly staff, quiet room , spotlessly clean, delicious breakfast, fantastic location .... We will go back soon

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: E W
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris so we were somewhat nervous about hotel selection. We narrowed the finalists to three and then selected this hotel. It turned out to be the absolute best choice from a quiet standpoint after walking by the other two hotels during our stay. I look for clean, quiet, good service and access to metro. This hotel fit all. Our room had twin beds and was very nice size as was the bathroom. Even though our room was on the "main street, the hotel is located in a quiet residential area. So even the main street is very quiet at night. You can sleep, but at the same time get to the metro in a two minute walk. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms spotless. Beatrix was very pleasant as were other members of the staff. They even allowed us to purchase a bottle of wine from the market across the street and sit in the garden and drink it. And the hotel provided the bottle opener and glasses at no charge. Visit the bakery and fruit stand next to the hotel. They were great. As was the small market across street for wine. Great prices. Having a refrigerator in the room really helped with food cost as well. This hotel made our stay in Paris so enjoyable. I almost hate to rate it this well for fear it will become so popular we won't be able to get a room when we go back. I would absolutely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: brenda j
Reviews.Content: ;We spent one week in a nice and spacious room overlooking the garden. We hesitated very much before choosing the right place for our anniversary in Paris and did not regret at all our choice. The comfort is excellent, beds are first class and everythijng is spotlessly clean. The desk staff is very helpful and polite, they gave us a lot of good addresses and printed our boarding passes. The location is a real plus, close to everything in an upscale area. Don't hesitate, go ahead and reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IGF
Reviews.Content: Efficient, spotless hotel; old-fashioned rooms with modern bathrooms and an attractive outdoor terrace on the street level. Staff pleasant and helpful. The hotel is near the Musee d'Orsay, Rodin Museum and within walking distance to the main hub of the Left Bank. The Centre Pompidou is within a reasonable hike.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet, Comfortable Choice”
Reviews.Author: Helen8631
Reviews.Content: The front door of the hotel is located at the end of a lovely, long entryway off the Rue de Bourgogne, itself a quiet street. The rooms are pleasant and very clean. Breakfast can be had either outdoors or in the small dining room. People at the front desk are very helpful. This was our second stay at the hotel, and we would be happy to return on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel at exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: rustycat83
Reviews.Content: Just completed a three night stay at Hotel de Varenne, a wonderful boutique hotel with personal service, a great location, and excellent rooms. Rooms are large, clean, well furnished and relatively inexpensive for this section of Paris. Very near Invalides, Rodin, and Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler and outstanding restaurants. We stayed in room 41 (fourth floor overlooking small courtyard) and had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower....very special. The courtyard is nice to sit outside and relax and enjoy a quiet moment after a long day. HIghly recommend this hotel and definitely will stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: salman k
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Paris and at Le Varenne. Rooms and service are perfect. We will remember for years our one week stay there. Their location is number one and the value excellent. We also loved the breakfast taken in the nice little garden.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connie B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Varenne for a week in September. The rooms are lovely and the hotel is close to the metro and all the major sites. It is located off the busy tourist path which is a real plus. We have been to Paris on several occasions and absolutely love it! If you're looking for a quiet hotel off the busy streets of Paris, we highly recommend the Hotel de Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place, Great Location, No Shower”
Reviews.Author: dianet123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely little hotel in September. The location is terrific, within a 30 minute walk or an easy metro ride to most of the major sites and museums. The exterior has a nice little garden - a lovely place to sit and sip a glass of wine while relaxing between afternoon adventures and dinner plans, if the weather cooperates. Because of the setback garden and the relatively quiet street, the rooms are very quiet. Our room, on the top floor, actually had a view of the Eiffel Tower from one of the windows. I don't think any other rooms have that view - so be sure to ask for the room on the 4th floor with that view. And the price is reasonable (for Paris). We paid about $260 per night. But there are some important downsides - mostly focussed around the bathroom. As noted above, our room did not have a shower. There was a large tub (that did not drain properly - though they called in a plumber to fix this for us), and a handheld showerhead. If you like to stand under a shower, forget it - that is just not possible. We also thought that the towels were cheap feeling, and the hotel did not provide some toiletries I usually expect to see such as lotion and a vnity kit. It's a trade off - I would be happy stay here again because of the location and charm. My husband would rather stay elsewhere next time because of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased that we stayed at Hotel de Varenne and definitely recommend it. Great location to many many of the Paris sights, as well as to the subway. Two blocks from the Rodin Museum. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean,comforatable and quiet rooms. Courtyard was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location...a delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wandzia22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel de Varenne in mid-June of this year. While this delightful hotel is just a short walk from the Seine, the Louvre, Les Invalides and the Place de la Concorde, it sits on a quiet street that boasts a wonderful patisserie next door, and excellent restaurants, galleries and shops within a block or two â€” all in a quiet neighbourhood that made us feel as if we were actually "living" in Paris rather than just visiting. The rooms are large, quiet and well appointed. And the staff is helpful without being intrusive. I recommend it highly and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “excellent small hotel in the Invalides district”
Reviews.Author: Cloudseleyshovell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet street surrounded by excllent restaurants (a three star restaurant is a five minute walk) and 200 m from the Musee Rodin. There is a small garden within the hotel walls with tables for reading or chatting. The rooms are well furnished with traditional furniture, bathrooms well fitted with modern fixtures and well supplied. Bedroom furniture, specifically, beds, are provided with comfortable mattresses, excellent linens and warm duvets. Views are unimportant here - the rooms are habitable, comfortable and, in Paris, it is better to be out on the streets and be part of the view. The one elevator is quite small and with one passenger and baggage, quite enough. The staff is superb, concerned, most competent and a pleasure to meet. A further note on the furnishings here - very traditional, comfortable, nothing of the super modern here. My fifth visit to Paris and I so wish I had found this hotel the first time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: seilenna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at the end of summer. The front desk was polite,knowledgeable, helpful and multi-lingual. Spacious, quiet, clean room for 3. Close to Musee Rodin, Musee D'Orsay, Eiffel Tower and Invalides. Within long walk of Louvre, Notre Dame, Sainte Chappelle etc. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de Varenne is just perfect”
Reviews.Author: benjamin b
Reviews.Content: This is our second time there and we loved it each time. It is even better now with their new bedding, so comfortable and sweet. The location can't be beaten, close to everything. the kindness and professionnalism of the staff is second to none. We have have already reserved for the third time.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything”
Reviews.Author: marianapd
Reviews.Content: My two granddaughters and I stayed here from the 21st til the 25th of August. The first night in Paris the gentleman at the desk gave us directions to some nearby restaurants. As we were walking toward the restaurants crossing in front of place d'invalid we could see the Eiffel tower right in front of us. After we finished diner we walked about five blocks and had a beautiful view of the tower as it lit up on the hour. We had single beds and one bed was added, the room was quite spacious for a Paris hotel room. We had breakfast one morning in the dining room and one morning in the garden. The other two mornings we found cafes along the street.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Varenne is an excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: DChapin1
Reviews.Content: My family and I, a total of 8 people, just spent 8 days staying at the Hotel de Varenne and we loved every minute. The location could not be better for viewing the sights of old city Paris and the staff is extremely courteous. This was our 3rd trip to Paris in the last 6 years and we will seriously consider staying at the Hotel de Varenne again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirecritic
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this wonderful hotel. Situated in a quiet street in the heart of Paris, close to all the major sights. Tour buses, metro and river buses all within 5 mins walk. Beautiful secluded courtyard away from the hustle and bustle. Staff attentive, rooms immaculate and well appointed. This is the perfect place to stay. Book it. Now.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: thereset
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff make this well worth recommending. We stayed here for 4 nights in late August. The hotel is very small with no licensed bar or restaurant. It does provide wifi access in room and there is one computer available in the reception area. There is a small outside area with seating. The decor is a little dated (more 1990s than 2010s) but none the worse for it. Our room was small, but the bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept on and the bathroom was well mooernised although we would have appreciated a wall mounting for the shower - you either had to hold the shower head in your hand or resort to using the bath. Anyway, it's clean and comfortable and we enjoyed the location on the Rue de Bourgogne- quiet but central enough to be able to walk easily to most places (bear in mind that we're English and used to walking!), there are metro and RER stations in easy walking distance too. breakfast was good for 11 euros, but there are plenty of cafes and boulangeries nearby if you want to buy your own.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect and will return!”
Reviews.Author: JJandJinMauritius
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel for exploring Paris! This was our first trip to this beautiful city and the Hotel de Varenne provided 5 star service and location with a 3 star price tag. Staff were always extremely friendly and accommodating and the area is a serene hideaway within the bustle of the tourist traps. The Metro is just around the corner, as is the Rodin museum, Les Invalides and Rue Cler (head for Cafe la Roussillon for the best cheese platter) and on the same street is a marvellous bakery perfect for your take-away breakfast of coffee and croissant. Regarding room size, we did pay a little extra for the superior (room 42 / 4th floor) but did not regret it as our room was comfortable, spacious and quiet, with double-french windows that could be opened to the tranquility of the street below. Highly recommended and bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a good price”
Reviews.Author: travelcunnuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 2nd to 4th and were very satisfied. We booked online to get the advertised 40% discount at 129 euros. The place is less than a 3 minute walk from the Varenne metro (subway) as well as one of the stops for hop on hop off bus circuits (Open tours). within a 100 meters of the hotel you will find a variety of restaurants: Vietnamese (le lotus blanc), French (le sac a dos) both of which are very well reviewed on tripadvisor, there is Italian(Giallo Oro: see my review) as well as Japanese. There is also a bakery (Pradier patisserie) one block north were we went for our continental breakfast every morning (for a fraction of the price that the hotel was charging) All the rooms face into a beautiful little courtyard so there is no road noise whatsoever. The room was clean, the bed very comfortable and the air conditioning was welcome during our stay (27 Celsius). Wi-Fi reception from our 3rd floor room was very good, we had no problem making our Skype video calls to Canada. The room was of a decent size (for europe) very quiet. This was actually one of the few hotel that took the care to calibrate there door mechanism to click shut instead of SLAMMING shut. Very appreciated when guests come in late at night. The person at the front desk was very courteous and when I inquired about Wi-Fi promptly gave me a piece of paper with the code. He also spoke English and French. (I write this to dispel 2 grudges from an earlier review). I even asked to use an iron. He apologized that I couldn't do it in my room so I ironed in the hotel laundry room. When we asked if we could order something and sit in their courtyard, he informed us that they only served soft drinks and promptly brought us a 750 ml bottle of Perrier. While we were there the elevator stopped working and the front desk apologized and informed us it would take a week to fix. Because of this, they did not hesitate and volunteered to bring down our large suitcases on our day of departure. The previous review mentioned that they stayed in a newly renovated room and we can attest that just before we left for our first day activities (around 9 am) we heard them renovating next door, but when we came back it was dead silence for the remainder of our stay. So, a couple of oddities during our stay but I would not hesitate in the least to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.Helpful staff and great position.”
Reviews.Author: Sue53_11
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel.Nice size room(most rooms we've chosen in Paris have been very small)Close to a Metro station and within walking distance to museums and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T DO BETTER !!!”
Reviews.Author: charles k
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my wife and daughter one week ago and I completely disagree with previous reviewer. Yes the location is perfect but this is not the only quality of this hotel. The comfort of the rooms is first class. We experienced a friendly and perfect english speaking staff, everybody from the chamber maids to the receptionists is polite and eager to please. They gave us perfect advises about directions with the metro, tips for restaurants and assistance with our computer connection. The wifi is working well and we did not get any difficulties obtaining the code from the receptionist. My daughter is a "facebook" addict, like most of the teenagers, and she even could connect with the hotel's computer in the little lounge downstairs as lons as she wanted and for free ! Real good thing for her and for me too... Anyway we had a great time there and spent really good holidays in Paris. The Varenne made our stay really special and we recommend it without any restriction.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: SydneyJedi
Reviews.Content: Oh come on. I mean I know it's peak season and Paris is full and I'm lucky to have got a room at all (according to friends). But I booked this ages ago and I did so because it scored well on TripAdvisor. Maybe I've under-estimated how much you pay for bad service in Paris but this place is all wrong. Location: couldn't be better. Room size: fine. Services: wifi worked (once I bribed the password out of the staff). But the staff are absolutely terrible. No greeting, no eye contact and...get this...no word of French! The so-called receptionist I spoke to mumbled barely in English but it looked like an effort. A word to the owners: you can't charge these prices and provide this lack of service. A word to potential visitors: You Can Do Better Elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lyskamm049
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. Room are average size for Paris (= medium-small). Atmosphere is very calm, elegant. The hotel is very clean although there is rug everywhere, which I am lways suspicious of. Bathroom was OK, with shower made of a curtain in the bath tub. Tiling is elegant. There is a safe available. Personnel is professional. Breakfast is just bread, butter jam and coffee/tea but the bread is excellent and coffee very good. We paid 180â‚¬/night for a double room with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “An extraordinary hotel with true Parisian charm and character”
Reviews.Author: KevinMP
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of being guests at the Hotel de Varenne for two weeks and it was consistently fabulous during our entire stay. The charm of this hotel was both in the physical attributes of the hotel as well as the wonderful people who worked there and made you feel at home (we brought our 5 month old son along with us, and he was showered with smiles and attention). The attention to detail in this hotel is very apparent. We stayed in one of their deluxe rooms and it was very spacious and quiet. It had a very comfortable bed, and a spacious modern bathroom (complete with bidet). All the furnishings were of high quality and very well coordinated. The room included air conditioning, a flat screen TV, a small fridge and a programmable safe (large enough to fit a laptop). It was a very nice touch to have a Bose sound system in which you could dock your iPhone/iPod (handy for charging). Also the complementary WiFi was fantastic. It was also a nice touch when the hotel staff offered us use of plates, wine glasses, etc. if we wanted to bring food back to the hotel for lunch or dinner in the garden (which we did a number of times). The breakfasts were always a delight with fresh baguettes every morning from the artisan bakery two door from the hotel. Breakfast was a very pleasurable experience since you could exchange stories with fellow travelers and it never felt rushed (the breakfast staff were very pleasant as well). The hotel has a wonderful courtyard that is very peaceful for breakfast, or relaxing with a bottle of wine. The location of the hotel is superb. The Rodin Museum and the Invalides are literally around the corner (2 min walk). It's a very clean and safe area (lots of embassies around with lots of police). Everything is so central and most things are well within comfortable walking distance (Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Champs Elysees, Rue de Cler, Blvd St. Germaine, etc). The Varenne metro is only a few minutes walk from the hotel which gives you very efficient access to the rest of Paris. The Hotel de Varenne is one of those truly unique and charming places that makes your stay in Paris so memorable.... and leaves your heart aching to go back to Paris as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it and will return!”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaToowoomba
Reviews.Content: This beautiful little gem is worth the money - gorgeous people; beautiful rooms; tasteful decor and the location is perfect. Can't fault this place it is just lovely and I highly recommend it to everyone wondering where to stay in Paris - unless you want the big hotel experience. This is small and very friendly, intimate, and the service is wonderful. Very chic, very French.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel - very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: complex_blonde
Reviews.Content: I was taking my fiance on a surprise trip to Paris for his 30th birthday. I wanted a central hotel which was cosy and romantic but not too expensive. I saw the reviews on here and decided to book the hotel. I was not disappointed - the hotel has a brilliant location for those who want to explore the city on foot. It is really near the Latin Quarter but also the river, the Eiffel Tower etc. Great as a base. The hotel is small and our room was small but very clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was lovely - great power shower. Very quiet at night. The hotel staff were very helpful in organising various parts of our trip before we arrived and booked us into 2 fantastic restaurants for the Friday anad Saturday night so we didn't have to trapse around the city finding somewhere to eat. Defintiely try Chez Francoise and see my review on that. They give you until 12 to check out which we thought was really good (and rare). Only negative thing is that breakfast is not included in the price - it is 11 euros extra which seemed quite a lot for a continental breakfast of essentially bread and jam! It didn't bother us though as there are so many fantastic bakeries/cafes etc - just get breakfast out. Overall a very good hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pecos28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in at the end of July 2011. We found the location to be excellent and pretty central to everything in Paris. Being a big city, you will still have trouble walking everywhere. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. We found the rooms to be a pretty decent size and clean. The one gentleman at the front desk was rather unhelpful with making some dinner reservations, but the other two front desk employees were very willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ryu1974
Reviews.Content: well priced, comfortable, large rooms for Paris. The concierges very very knowledgable and professional. Very thankful for their restaurant tips as the surrounding area was a bit disappointing for food.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: WATravel65
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel from all the excellent reports on tripadvisor and were not let down. This hotel is located on a little street in Paris very quiet. It is well hidden from the front of the road. The rooms are well appointed and are fairly large for hotels in Paris. Most of the attractions are about a 15 min walk or there is a metro station just around the corner and a bus stop about a 2 min walk. Wifi is free and the people at the front desk also speak good english. The rooms also have a/c which is a good thing in Paris if it is hot. Would stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy place; great service”
Reviews.Author: searchexcellence
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a small week to visit a relative living at the Invalides. The hotel is very nice with a patio. Decoration is classical. The staff is very kind: I complained that the banging of doors made too much noise and they fixed it overnight. Breakfast is good but limited in choice and quantity Bathroom are OK

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: PSandWC
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for work and my husband was along for the ride. We found this hotel on Trip Advisor. It was perfect from beginning to end. The service was superb, the breakfast (especially the team and chocolate croissants) was outstanding. The location was perfect for metro access and walking to museums. We stayed in a superior room the first few nights on the third floor. It was comfortable and quiet. We moved to a smaller room the last night on the second floor and it was just as nice. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and gracious with our limited grasp of the French language.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very well kept!”
Reviews.Author: jswhtravel
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fabulous for exploring the city. We were able to easily walk to the main attractions in Paris, and a metro stop is nearby for those who prefer to ride. The hotel is tucked in quiet street for those that want to be centrally located but avoid the city noise at night. The hotel desk was friendly and spoke very good English (as well as several other languages). We had a very young child with us and the hotel was very friendly about providing a child bed and high chair. Our room was spotless and in very good condition. You could tell that the rooms had been recently renovated. The rooms are not especially large but we had plenty of room to move around, even with the child bed. A great deal and I would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location. Quiet, clean, & comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SD_gallivant
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along our six-year old daughter traveled to Paris in July and stayed in this fine hotel for 5 days. I usually book through the hotel's website, but was glad that I booked this via email because I learned that they could add an extra/roll out bed to some of the rooms (ours was the standard twin with bath) to accommodate our child, whereas the website doesn't present you with that option. The staff is pleasant and courteous. They appeared rather serious, and only responded with information and advice when asked. An older gentleman, who worked at the front desk a brief time during our stay, perked up with enthusiasm and was very helpful in giving us restaurant recommendations on a Sunday, when everything looked closed on our street. We ended up eating at Le Basilic, which was lovely. A couple mornings, the reception seemed overwhelmed (likely due to July being busy), which can affect breakfast room service. The first time, breakfast delivery to the room took an extremely long time and I had to call and check if it was still coming. The second time, reception completely forgot to place our breakfast order with the kitchen, which resulted in a long, hungry wait in our room until I finally went downstairs to inquire about it. I would recommend just going to the dining room or patio for breakfast so you can order directly from the kitchen staff to ensure timely service. Our room on the 2nd floor was clean and comfortable, and faced the beautiful courtyard where breakfast is served (when weather is permitting). The windows are of high quality and seal out any street noise when closed. But even with windows opened, street noise was minimal. The rooms are small and cozy, but of average size by European standards. One of us would have to get up from the desk to allow the other to walk by when moving about the room. There is a closet, refrigerator, safe, and all the basic bathroom amenities - hair dryer, towel warmer (though was turned off in summer) shampoos, conditioner and shower gel. They even have several umbrellas in the lobby for you to borrow and use for your day out. Their free internet is great. The location can't be beat. The Varenne Metro stop is a short 5 minute walk. The hotel is central to all the sights and activities around Paris. The streets in this neighborhood are clean, and a produce store, bakery, grocery store, and a few restaurants are all a few steps away. Whenever finishing a long, busy day in Paris, we loved coming "home" to this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: motherell14
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is an "excellent place", a perfect little hotel to stay in the center of Paris. Nothing pretentious but very well decorated and managed. Guests are really considered as guests, not only clients if you see what I mean. The sleep quality is superb and the comfort of the rooms amazing. But the real thing is the location, number one. We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The pleasure of a homey place”
Reviews.Author: valenciatrump
Reviews.Content: Coming from Panama for business in Paris I have been very surprised by the exceptional quality of the service at Hotel de Varenne. The staff is very efficient and polite. The location of the hotel is superb and close to everything. What a change to stay in a family run place compared to our international huge hotels. You are considered as a real guest, not just a number. Congratulations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice retreat”
Reviews.Author: ranistonatlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nestled in the 7th district of Paris and close to everything. The location is fantastic and very quiet. Our room was large and comfortable with very efficient A/C. We had a very nice stay there and enjoyed every minute of our time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Herd2001
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for our first trip to Paris. This hotel is off the beaten path, yet close to everything! The hotel is very tiny, but the room seemed large. The courtyard was fabulous for having coffee in the mornings and wine in the evenings. The staff was very nice and helpful. Also, everyone at the front desk spoke English, which was great for us, since our French is very limited. The hotel room had AC and a frig. This hotel is very close to a couple of Metro stations and lots of tourist attractions. There are also a few markets nearby to pick up snacks and such for your room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: rcyeadon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I toured France for two weeks at the end of May and started in Paris. We stayed at the Hotel de Varenne for three nights and were very pleased. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood and the bed was comfortable so we enjoyed peaceful sleeping. And it was close to many top attractions. We had a deluxe room that was comfortable and clean. We had breakfast brought to the room. It was simple but tasty and plentiful for two and prompt. Highly recommended Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tallmantraveling49
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful way to stay in Paris. Located in a residential/government area, you feel much more a local than a tourist. The courtyard entrance is great prelude to the quiet escape the place provides. Rooms are more than adequate. Front desk service is very caring and attentive. Very clean and well kept; albeit not modern. Wonderful restaurants (although stay away from the pasta place next door!), patisseries,, boulangeries and fruit/vegetable stores right there plus some good high end shopping. Quiet, good value, non touristy, and very good way to stay in Paris. The Rodin museum is at the end of the street and the Orsay Musee is a ten minute walk...great location

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: machughesnueltin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is top notch. it is close to everything in Paris, located in a select area full of embassies and public buildings. We had and comfortable room overlooking the garden, very quiet and spotlessly clean. Congratulations to all the staff for their kindness and disponibility.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: siva2
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Hotel de Varenne in May. We were extremely pleased with the location, a quiet street in a very convenient location. We were able to walk to all the places we wanted to see, but returned to a peaceful neighborhood. All members of the staff we encountered were courteous and helpful. The room was very small, but well laid out. There was plenty of space for our luggage. Our only complaint is that the bed was not queen size although our reservation said it would be. We would stay here again. However, I would reserve twin beds in order to have more sleeping space.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: dougdow
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is everything said before. We had a great time there and the comfort is exquisite. But what is really excellent is the service. For example as soon as we arrived the owner himself took care of our luggage and carried them to our room. We had to go for the day to Lille : they reserved us train tickets and printed them in a minute. Same thing for our boarding passes to go back home. Congratulations to all the staff members. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a bit of quiet and refuge in the bustle of downtown Paris”
Reviews.Author: fhentinc
Reviews.Content: This was our most recent visit to the Hotel de Varenne, having returned after three other stays. You are made to feel very welcome from the time you enter the gates into a small courtyard to the lobby area. Mr.Jean Marc POMMIER was at his desk to greet us and take our bags to our room. The rooms are small to American standards of size but very comfortable and attractive. The bath area is more than adequate for the traveler. The entire hotel is very clean. Our best experience was when we had to foreshorten our trip and how helpful Mr. POMMIER was in arranging for our return home. We recommend the hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: indians_forever
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel based on the Trip Advisor review's and I wasnâ€™t disappointed. After all the positive reviews about this place thereâ€™s little left to say. All the superlatives used by previous reviewers are fair and square on Hotel de Varenne. Our family had a very enjoyable stay during the week during the Easter break. The front desk staff, shame on me for being so bad with names, was very professional and often checked on how satisfied we were with their services. In one occasion, after a horrendous couple of meals offsite, the South Asian, gentleman staffing the front desk, on us asking for recommendations, directed us to a close by small/homey restaurant, Le Sac a Dos, where we had our first of subsequent excellent meals in Paris. Having made the reservation 4 months in advance through an online travel site they made me aware that the room reserved wasnâ€™t suitable for us and our young daughter. However, they immediately offered us an alternative. On arrival, everything was delivered as and when promised. Rooms are nicely decorated and the cleaning staff does an excellent job. As they say in real estate, location, location, location. Next to Musee Rodin and Les Invalides, Hotel de Varenne is located in a quiet street yet accessible to everything. For those wanting to explore and discover little Parisian corners the Eiffel Tower is a 20 minutes walk. The Varenne Metro station is around the corner. Taxi from Charles de Gaulle charges around $50 Euros. The area is very secure as there are several embassies and government dependencies in the vicinity. Based on this experience with Hotel de Varenne I wonâ€™t hesitate in staying there again and again whenever in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyTravellers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Close to many attractions and yet in a very quiet location. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Courtyard garden very pleasant to relax after a busy day sightseeing. One minor gripe is that there is limited space in the dining area for breakfast, particularly if it is raining or cold and the outside courtyard cannot be used. There are several bars and restaurants close by and cake shops, greengrocer and supermarket for all your extra needs. We would definitely stay there again on any future visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: iloveparistoo
Reviews.Content: A friend who visits Paris regularly recommended Hotel Varenne to me, and I'm so glad she did. Our room was small but it had everything we needed, including a hair dryer, air conditioning, and comfortable beds. The continental breakfast was reasonable and the coffee was excellent. If you don't want their breakfast, there is a bakery two doors down which had the best almond croissant I've every had; they also put out lunch goodies later in the day although we didn't buy any. The hotel has a little courtyard, and you can have breakfast there if you want. The location couldn't have been better. Just around the corner was the Rodin Museum. About five blocks from the hotel was the Eiffel Tower and the Seine, and we were in the middle of numerous cafes and shops. Two Metro stops were also just around the corner from the hotel, so it was extremely convenient to get to the Champs or the Louvre. Be sure to check out the hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JPOS_CA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been reviewed very accurately. It is a high quality, well run and clean hotel in a very central location. The rooms could be considered small by US standards, but not really for Europe. yes they have quirky dimensions, some parts of the rooms may have low ceilings, but overall well appointed. I even found the breakfast quite satisfying for 11 Euros (GREAT coffee!) The location was fantastic. I walked everywhere, but the Metro is very close, bike rental (less than $2/day) was also convenient and all the sights of Invalides and the Rodin Museum. One caveat is the neighborhood is quiet at night, fine for nice dinners, but not for more exciting activities. I strongly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Very homey hotel.”
Reviews.Author: faruz
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the staff member we later called "Grandpa". We love grandpa, he just gives this hotel the feel of home. In our 5 days trip, we met the rest of the staff which were also very polite and friendly (But not as friendly as "grandpa"). The location is obviously great. Its 2km from everywhere. 2km from the Eiffel Tower, 2km from the Champs-Elysees, 2km from the Louvre, close to the latin quarter and just in the middle of everything. Across the street you can visit Rodin Museum which is also quite pleasant. (If you're a "lite" art fan, and the louvre is just too much for you - go there). Now for the room. We got a small room, #44. The bed was 1.40m wide, which is not something we're costumed to. The room looked very clean, the shower and toilets were modern and clean. My wife did claim though, that the bed gave her itches. I did not suffer from this problem and we were too scared to look under the sheets... We did ask to move to a bigger room, preferably with a bed to support my 1.90m (6''2), and we were told by the management "tomorrow" for a couple of days. After 3 days, we gave up and decided to stay in our tiny chamber. Our flight left at night, and although the hotel was not fully booked, we were not allowed to stay in our room later than 2pm. Manager wanted 80 euros to let us use the room until 7pm. I offered 20... he refused. I hate when hotels do that and not let you enjoy the last day of your trip as pleasant as possible. Breakfast costs 11 euros and you get coffee, a couple of croissants and some jam. It sounds expensive, I know, but its normal price for Paris it seems... And of course, free wi-fi!! On and all it was a pleasant stay, considering all the pros and cons. Biggest tip: When you check-in, look behind the manager, there's a board of room numbers and prices. If possible, try to switch to a room number that costs more. They are bigger and more pleasant for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TasmanianTourist
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Varenne provides an oasis of calm and comfort in this busy city. The breakfast area and foyer and entrance say it all. Lovely decor, lovely rooms, clean and excellent service. Everyone was helpful. We stayed a week and we will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: noonah14
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 night stay at Hotel de Varenne. It is set back from the street so remarkably quiet for Paris. The room was comparatively large and very comfortable, with modern bathroom and very nicely furnished. The location is fantastic, next door to a quality artisan boulangerie (bakery) and a couple of minutes from the metro. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: travel4now
Reviews.Content: This is lovely hotel is close to all that Paris has to offer. We felt like we were in a truly French neighborhood yet close to all the tourist attractions. The bakery next door and the grocery across the street were of high quality. My favorite find in the neighborhood was a jewelery maker on an adjoining street. Great work at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “The country side downtown”
Reviews.Author: bond00714
Reviews.Content: This place is really perfect for a quiet stay downtown. It is surprising to find such a silence in the center of a big city. We could even sleep with the windows opened. Hard to believe when you live in NYC. Besides this particular quality, the comfort and the service are awesome. Real good choice. Once again thanks to Tripadvisors reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: astromnorway
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel in a quiet and chic area. Our room was of good size and seemed to be freshly renovated. Plenty of tasty restaurants nearby, specially Chez FranÃ§oise. Musee Rodin is just around the corner and "Les Invalides" one block away. The little garden is charming, we had breakfast there every morning and enjoyed it very much. Very good choice for a Paris break.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay for a few nights in paris”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: As this was not our first trip to Paris, we wanted to stay on a quieter street in a different/not so touristy part of town. Hotel de Varenne was a great choice. Highlights: 1) right around the corner from the Rodin museum and garden, and about a 10/15 minute walk to the water and all the major sites - or a 15 minute walk to the eiffel tower 2) right around the corner from the Varenne Metro stop 3) front desk staff were all very helpful and friendly 4) great value for Paris 5) free wi fi 6) quiet neighborhood - and a short walk to more action 7) italian restaurant a few doors down was quite good 8) lovely/quiet garden for breakfast Potential drawbacks depending on how you like to travel: 1) elevator is tiny and barely fits 1 person with luggage - but it's Paris, so that is fairly common, you just have to be prepared for it 2) the rooms are very small, and we had a double bed that some people could think is small for 2 people. your neighbor can also see right in your room if your window is open at all 3) sleepy neighborhood - on a saturday night after 9pm we had a hard time finding anywhere open to eat at definite recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: whiteheadglasgow
Reviews.Content: Very quiet location fort his little charming hotel nestled in the center of Paris. We had a great time there with my husband. The owner speaks a good english and is very helpful at the front desk. He gave us very good advises for restaurants and directions. Our room was comfortable, specially the bedding. The bathroom was perfectly cleaned and large enough. We were happy to follow tripadvisor recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Value"”
Reviews.Author: asshtonatlanta
Reviews.Content: We paid only 159 â‚¬ per night for a nice room overlooking the garden. At this rate the service was perfect and the comfort excellent. We spent 4 nights there and enjoyed every minute of our stay. We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: browning57
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one week and enjoyed it very much. Perfect location downtown and really quiet. Nice room, well decorated and perfectly clean Very good breakfast served in the garden

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat”
Reviews.Author: goicoecheanicky
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to have some rest in the middle of Paris. Very friendly english speaking staff. Comfortable rooms and excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mcnamarasouthafrica
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with colleagues for a business meeting in Paris. Everything was perfect and our stay was a dream because of the excellent staff. The rooms are big enough, perfectly cleaned and really quiet. The breakfast is delicious and not expensive. If we happen to go back to Paris we will reserve there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GamerGirl-STL
Reviews.Content: The location really trumps all else with this hotel. Just 'round the block from the Varenne Metro, and half-a-block from the Rodin museum. Rooms are fine, breakfast is simple but lovely in a small courtyard. The elevator is tiny (barely room for two people to stand). Fantastic atmosphere and accessibility to Paris though.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: abdultarek
Reviews.Content: Going to Paris for my business I decided to reserve the hotel de varenne based on the good reviews posted on this site. I was not disappointed by the quality of the service and the comfort of my room. This hotel is a real hidden gem nestled in the heart of the 7th district. My room was extremely comfortable, well decorated and prefectly cleaned. The english speaking staff is polite and really helpful. I will keep a good souvenir of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights. The hotel is located in what our taxi driver called the most 'chic' address in Paris! It's a quite, safe location that is within walking distance of the eiffel tower (20 mins), the louvre (25 mins) and notre dame (30 mins). The rooms were clean and had a safe and fridge and the optional breakfast was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, quiet hotel in a very convient location!”
Reviews.Author: margone
Reviews.Content: I spent my 1st two nights alone in Paris at this quiet, small boutique hotel. The location is great and the neighborhood was very quiet and extremely safe. The staff was very helpful and very acommodating. I arrived tired from the long plane ride, early in the morning, and was told that my room was not quite ready, so they gave me a room that was ready. The breakfast was good and the recommendations for lunch and dinner were great! I would definitely stay there again and the price was right!!! 139 euro's for a lovely double room with full bath.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: guhuber
Reviews.Content: As said, a real hidden gem. Nice large rooms, perfect location and a very good service made this lovely little hotel one of the best choice if you re going to stay few nights in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Top service”
Reviews.Author: johnmanila83
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel with first class service. We enjoyed our stay there more than in any place in Europe. The room was perfectly clean and well decorated. The breakfast is delicious. And the rates are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel - will happily return”
Reviews.Author: Flinky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Varenne for four nights in early February. We would recommend it again without hesitation. Varenne itself is close to the Hotel des Invalides, on a quiet street with a village feel. i was expecting a student area, but nothing could be further from the truth - the area is very quietly very wealthy. If you wanted you would have everything within a five minute walk either side of the hotel, including a good selection of good small restaurants, a small supermarket, the Musee Rodin, a tabac, a chemist/pharmacy, and plenty of boulangeries! There was no shortage of places to have breakfast or dinner, which was handy - although the hotel does provide breakfast, it does not do dinner. Although it's close to the centre, Varenne is definitely not a tourist area, which for us was an absolute positive, and it was wonderful to be able to stay in an authentic, Parisian, residential area. i should stress that the area is in no way remote, but everything is very accessible. It feels like a very safe area, and we had no hesitation in walking around the area at night. Rarely did we have to take a taxi, and that was only out of laziness! The road is behind the Assembly Nationale, and there was no shortage of taxis if needed. It's fair to say the road was also patrolled by a lot of police, which did give it a very safe feel! It was so lovely to be away from the main tourist centres, and yet these were easily within reach - the Varenne metro stop is two minutes walk around the corner from the Hotel, and 2-3 stops to the centre of Paris. Place de la Concorde or Musee D'Orsay are probably ten minutes stroll away, and we explored the shops of St Germain, which are another 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. On our first evening we ambled to the Eiffel Tower, which took approximately 25 minutes. All in all, we did as much or as little walking as we liked, and never felt rushed. The hotel itself is small, very cosy, very comfortable and the beds were better than other hotels I've stayed in of similar age or cost. The room had a TV (with only News in English) and a Bose iPod speaker. The room is ensuite (we had a room with a bath), with a separate toilet and bidet, and the shower was fabulous! With a mixture of late and early starts, not once were we disturbed by housekeeping. The staff were exceptionally discrete. We were never woken by road or any other noise, even with the window open. Our room wasn't overlooked. The only downside was that there was no tea and coffee in the room, nor any iron or ironing board (we didn't ask for one, so the hotel may have them), but certainly wouldn't put us off staying again, or recommending the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jonathanpittsburgh
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel de varenne based on the very good reviews on tripadvisor and we have to say everything is true. We enjoyed every moment of our stay there. The staff is perfect, specially Beatrix. Our room was large according to european standard, very well decorated, quiet and perfectly clean. The breakfast is excellent and cheap, only 11 Euro. The location is superb, close to everything uin a very quiet part of the city. Do not hesitate to go there you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, fantastic staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideJess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this hotel on Expedia.com and we booked one of the last rooms after reading fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor. Took a taxi from Gare du Nord to the hotel for only about 10euro. When we checked in we were greeted by friendly staff and although we were early and it wasn't quite check-in time we were delighted to find that our room was ready! Our room was small, which we expected but was neat, always clean and had plenty of room for 2 people plus suitcases etc, we never felt cramped. It was also nice and warm which was lovely to return to each day after cold temperatures outside! The location is great, it's tucked away amongst quiet streets (which provided a nice quiet night sleep) but is still really close to everything. We went walking/exploring after checking in and within 15mins found ourselves on the Champs Elysees! Our hop-on hop-off bus stop was about a 5 min walk away too which was really handy. All the main attractions in Paris are actually pretty close anyway so one night we spent a couple of hours walking from the Arc de Triomphe to the Eiffel Tower and a few other spots - was beautiful all lit up at night! We didn't have breakfast included but literally a few doors down from the hotel is an award-winning patisserie which was fantastic and we just ate apple pastries or chocolate croissants every morning! The use of the safe in our room was free and so was the internet which we used from a computer in the lobby. A few times we asked the hotel staff about places or restaurants and each time they were more than happy to get out a map and show us exactly where to go. One recommendation was for a restaurant a few streets away called Le Basilic which was lovely with beautiful food. So glad we booked with this hotel and if we ever make it back to beautiful Paris, we will definitely book with Hotel de Varenne again!

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem of a Hotel in the 7eme”
Reviews.Author: 4lclover
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Hotel de Varenne and can highly recommend it. The staff went out of their way to help in every way they could. Location is just perfect and it is so quiet. Moreover, I left my wallet and my car keys in my room and both were sent to me within 48 hours of arriving home! Cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Book it now!

Reviews.Title: “safe and quiet in paris”
Reviews.Author: Leapy78
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the HÃ´tel de Varenne and have very little to complain about. The hotel is clean and comfortable, the staff are professional, helpful and polite. The neighborhood is quiet, residential, and safe, so if you want to be in the middle of the action, look elsewhere. I found it a peaceful retreat from being out in the hustle and bustle of the city. The WiFi is fast and free and I felt completely at ease leaving thousands of dollars of equipment (computer, camera gear, etc) in the room. The Metro is a two block walk, past the Rodin museum. The only downside might be that the hotel has very little in the way of food and drink, but there was a fridge in the room. All in all a great, hassle free stay. I have traveled to Paris my entire life, and this place is now a favorite. Their off-season internet prices are quite a bargain, too.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jackrussell30
Reviews.Content: Considering I have been staying in many hotels in Paris, I can say Hotel de Varenne is certainly one the best. The staff is incredible and the manager present at every moment. The rooms are very comfortable, well decorated and spotlessly cleaned. The breakfast is delicious and pretty cheap. We enjoyed very much our stay there and do not regret our choice. We will be back next month.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LondonKaytee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained with clean and well appointed rooms (if a little small). We had a room overlooking the courtyard and it was quiet. There are a number of good restaurants in the area and it is within easy walking distance of many Paris highlights. Just around the corner is the Musee Rodin which we hadn't visited before but is well worth a visit. We were there on a wet day in late November but would like to return in spring/summer/autumn to see garden at its best. Museum also has pleasant cafe/restaurant in garden.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very quiet, very nice”
Reviews.Author: funsville
Reviews.Content: I doubt I have ever stayed at a hotel that was quieter at night. Usually hotel noise keeps me from falling asleep. Not a problem here. They even have a door that shuts between the staircase and the rooms so that you do not hear the people walking up and down to and from their rooms. Though the room was a typically small Paris room, it had lots of shelf space and a nice big bathroom and it was very clean. It was quite convenient to the Varenne metro stop. Just steps away from the Rodin museum, and L'Arpege restaurant (though as my husband said, if you can go to L'Arpege, you are probably not staying in a three star hotel...) and Invalides is an easy walk too. Make sure you bring your own shampoo, conditioner and bars of soap. They provide a soap wash and an all-in-one shower wash, but no bars of soap and no separate shampoo and conditioner. Just a couple of doors down from the hotel is an artisan bakery that looks fantastic, though we didn't get to try it. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. All in all, we were very pleased with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: pennylaw
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor and it didn't disappoint. It's 5 minutes walk from a metro station and within walking distance to Musee Rodin, Invalides, Musee d'Orsay and if you are inclined, you can even walk to Avenue de Champs Elysees. Checking in was fast and fuss-free and the staff were always friendly and pleasant. Our room was spacious for Paris's standards and I loved that it is in a quiet neighbourhood. The little courtyard in front of the hotel is lovely too though we didn't get to use it since we visited in winter. Only problems we had was the heater was not warm enough and we were left shivering in the middle of the night. There was also no kettle in the room but the hotel obliged by sending hot water up to the room when we requested. All in all, it's a good hotel in a great location. I'd certainly stay here again if I ever chose to Paris again. Two thumbs up :)

Reviews.Title: “Solid and met expectations”
Reviews.Author: midwestern_guy51
Reviews.Content: was in paris for a wedding and was looking for something close to d'Orsay. Chose this hotel based on comments on tripadvisor and was not disappointed at all. Hotel staff, everyone, was super friendly and helpful. The lobby and entry are the best parts, very charming. The room was perfectly suitable, not sumptuous by anymeans, but very comfortable and surprisingly reasonable in cost. I wondered what it would have been like to have one of the more expensive rooms. Great location, close to the Rodin museum and great shops and restaurants on the same street. Also close to Invalides and to the Varenne stop. We were sad to leave wondering if we would ever be back here. Great, nothing to complain about here. Breakfast was not included in my rate, but I thought that 11 euros was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, quiet and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: tobrien1184
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at Hotel de Varenne for four nights during a November 2010 visit to Paris. I selected the hotel based on recommendations on TripAdvisor, and was not disappointed. The only minor hitch - beds not arranged as twins as I had requested in advance - was corrected quickly by the hotel staff on the evening of our arrival. Our room, which overlooked Rue de Bourgogne, was comfortable, clean, and relatively roomy. There was more than sufficient heat to offset the mid-November chill. The bathroom was quite well-appointed, although the tub/shower was very narrow, and may prove difficult for some people to navigate. Everything else about our experience - housekeeping, breakfast meals, restaurant, shopping and transportation guidance from the staff - all were flawless. The location was a great balance between quiet and convenience (a small grocery across the street, a produce shop and a bakery down the street, as well as a Metro stop within 2 blocks.) For travelers who can do without the amenities of a large, full-service hotel, I would recommend this hotel, and would definitely consider staying here again on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: drnovak
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Varenne is in an excellent location in the 7eme. You can easily walk to Invalides, the Rodin Museum or the Orsay from the hotel The staff is very polite and knowledgeable. Our room was a very nice size and clean. The hotel was generally very quiet and relaxing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Paris”
