Reviews.Author: Yorkshirecritic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically positioned 2 mins from the Musee Rodin and Les Invalides. 10 mins from the Musee D'Orsay and The Seine. The hotel is extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast is a little limited but there are a number of cafe bars locally. The staff are welcoming and helpful. Best of all the beds are great quality and the rooms air conditioned so a good nights sleep is guaranteed. Definitely going back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great base for a Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: KilosUk
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this boutique hotel, its small - the lift could barely fit one piece of luggage! but the rooms are a reasonable size (for Paris) with plenty of space to fit the cot..(which was kindly provided by the hotel). The rooms and hotel were kept spotlessly clean. The staff were very friendly and most helpful with any queries we had about the area. The concierge was there 24/7 and allowed us to store the pram under the stairs for the duration of our trip, which saved us getting it up and down the stairs. The location is fantastic within short walking distance of the main areas / attractions and plenty of shops close to hand. The only thing missing (as others have mentioned) was tea and coffee making facilities in the room or in reception to take up.. We were travelling with our young baby and within 15 minutes walk we were able to find restaurants that were happy to allow the pram in the evening, so we could eat whilst she slept. We would definitely recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: rambling_rosie
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel with my husband and another couple for a long weekend in Paris. The location was perfect for all the things we wanted to do: Musee Rodin (just around the corner), Monet Exhibition at the Grand Palais (short walk), boat trip on the Seine (for a friend's special birthday party) and plenty of restaurant options at Montparnasses or St Germain (short walk). The room was small but very comfortable. The only thing that was missing was a kettle in the room (for those early morning and mid afternoon cups of tea) and some fruit for breakfast. Other than that I would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: javajunkie3
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel, the courtyard is a special touch. The breakfast was nice with fresh croissants, baguetts and nice strong coffee. Room was on the small side but very clean and cozy. I was on the courtyard closest to the entrance and the street traffic at night was a bit much with the windows open, so the second night I just closed the windows and put on the ac which worked out just fine. The staff was very knowledgable about the area - and sent me to a wonderful street market on Sunday Morning where I shopped until I couldn't cary one more thing...cheese, bath salts, bread, clothes, table linnen etc...very authentic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wish for more”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas031
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here with our 7 year old. The hotel is small and personal with the majority of rooms overlooking its own courtyard. Our room was one of the larger ones that overlooked the street which was quiet enought with the windows closed. We all loved this place - it's location, the neighbourhood, the staff, the room. Breakfast in the delightful dining room was delicious. We got a hefty discount by booking early on the internet which resulted in a bargain price. Staff are friendly, helpful and fluent with English. After leaving the hotel we discovered that we had left behind some clothing - when we contacted the hotel they had put it aside awaiting our return. Greta service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Boutique Hotel with Neighborhood Charm and Hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: ddouglass
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with my stay at this hotel on my first trip to Paris. This hotel has a very professional, helpful, and friendly staff. I got one of the smaller, less expensive rooms. It was small but very clean, charming, and well appointed. It looked out over a very quite courtyard and I was able to sleep with my windows open which I donâ€™t get a chance to do very often living in Miami Beach where its too hot most of the year. I loved having the large safe for my laptop. The location is perfect. It is on a quite street convenient to neighborhood bakeries and shops yet close to all of the famous Paris sites. I have many pleasant memories of my trip because of my experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location - very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sfehenderson
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on 2 different occasions and both times were very impressed with the rooms, the staff and the over all feel of the hotel - the rooms we had,18 & 22, were both good sized rooms, and very quiet. I would certainly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JRH54
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel de Varenne for 3 nights and would certainly stay here on our next visit to Paris. The rooms were quite large and the court yard was a treat for a late afternoon snack and readying

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and nice... but expensive”
Reviews.Author: SleepyPinga
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it has excellent location and received good reviews. Location was indeed good. Close to metro station and walking distance to the Concorde square, Invalides, and so on. It was quiet and we could sleep well at night. Room was not so big but that is to be expected in Paris. Considering the price of the hotel, we were surprised to find that we need to pay to use the safe in our room. As it was warm, it was good to have a small refrigerator and AC in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MNtraveler34
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon in France. It's near the Rodin Museum and Invalides. The courtyard at the hotel is nice and the neighborhood is very quiet. That's good and bad -- it's nice when you're ready to sleep, but there aren't many restaurants or cafes in the immediate neighborhood. Still, we'd recommend it and it was good for the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience in spite of some hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Amazing1672
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and had another booking for 2 more nights with a day's gap in between (had to go to Germany for biz). We found the place very clean with a Parisian look and feel, nicely situated in a quiet area at the same time very accessible to a number of Paris landmarks with easy access to Metro/ bus and with good service from the people at the front desk. For a Paris boutique hotel, this is definitely a gem. Couple of points to note though to prepare others considering a stay here - on Sundays the area around the hotel is pretty dead. If you are planning on skipping the breakfast in the hotel which is indeed meagerly, be prepared. The Patisseries that people have noted in other reviews just a few steps away are closed on Sundays and the bistro close to the Metro is closed as well. You have to walk a few blocks to find anything open to find food - so keep that in mind (walking is anyway a reality in Paris, so you should be prepared for that regardless). While we had no problems in our initial stay at the hotel and the hotel took good care of the luggage we left behind when we went on our 1 day trip to Germany, when we came back, we were told that our booking for 2 additional nights has been messed up. They apparently had some issue with double booking, so they had managed to get a room for us at a hotel a few blocks down (hotel Bourgogne et Montana). While we were pretty skeptical of this arrangement, we agreed to give it a shot as otherwise it would have meant we had to go searching for another hotel in the high July season. The lady at the front desk at Varenne made sure that we were fine with this arrangement, apologized a few times, walked with us to the other hotel rolling one of our big bags for us and made sure everything was all taken care of at the other hotel. We had a very pleasant stay at the Bourgogne et Montana as well (look at my other review on it) and overall I don't think there was anything to complain about in the way this was taken care of by the Hotel de Varenne folks. Overall, made us feel happy that they had managed to get us a booking and not just leave us fending for ourselves and that too in a perfectly decent place. I will highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb and delightful - refreshing surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_abroad255103
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. I am so glad we stayed here. We read the negative comments of a couple of reviewers and cannot see how they could possibly feel as they do. If they were not happy here then I am sure they will never be happy anywhere. The location is so convenient to everything - walk anywhere in a few minutes. The staff were so polite and helpful and they always friendly and accommodating. When we booked, we changed our minds several times about how many nights we needed and they helped us every time - Jean-Marc offered us excellent options. We stayed in room 41 which gave us a romantic view of the Eiffel tower from our bed. The bed was comfortable, the air conditioning was quiet and effective, large flat screen TV, high speed wireless internet, well appointed, clean bathroom tiled to the ceiling and serviced daily to a high standard. There is no restaurant but breakfast can be taken in pleasant wood paneled breakfast room (normal European breakfast of bread/croissant, juice, coffee etc) when in France expect to eat as the French do. The lift is small but this is the standard in Paris and quite adequate. The entrance to the hotel is not showy but reveals a peaceful and tranquil garden courtyard where we sat and enjoyed our own bottle of wine or odd snack that we purchased outside. We stayed 5 nights and are happy to be contacted by anyone wishing us to confirm this review.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: bakkelund1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very sweet and exactly what you imagine when you think 'Parisian' hotel, with a particularly nice courtyard area. We booked a Superior room and the staff were kind enough to allow us to have 2 children (4 and 8 years) in the same room with us which saved us from booking two rooms and spending even more on accomodation. I consider the price (230 Euros a night not including breakfast) quite steep for the standard of the hotel (which is 3 star) but the location is amazing! The district is very quiet (I saw many embassies and consulates as we walked around) but very close to everything, including the metro! We didn't use the Metro, however, preferring to walk everywhere. The reception staff were really lovely and helpful, however, the breakfast staff did not speak or seem to understand English which lead to many miscommunications and incorrect orders! In itself, this wouldn't have been a problem, but they were not at all friendly and did not share a smile with us in the two days we were there. Housekeeping was, likewise, not particularly friendly (not even a 'Bonjour' as we plassed in the hall) which is a shame as the front desk staff try hard to create a friendly atmosphere. I would stay in this hotel again and recommend it to a friend but mostly due to the location. I'm not sure it's rating as 3rd most popular hotel in Paris on Tripadvisor is warranted (at least it was at the time I booked) - generally I expect more from a hotel rated so highly on Tripadvsor.com.

Reviews.Title: “This is an awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: GusM
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Varenne, and it gets better each time. The staff was wonderful, and did everything to make our stay special as usual. We are looking forward to our next stay at Hotel Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: anniepotts66
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be very comfortable, clean and convenient to city sights. Lovely little area in courtyard to have drinks, or coffee. Breakfast was continental, so opted for patisseries in the street, many to choose from! Staff friendly and helpful each time when asked. Little supermarket in street, but others not far away either. Laundramat approx 15 mins walk away. Few restaurants in the area, were very nice and some not too expensive. Overall, pleasant place to stay in Paris, and would return. Rooms of a standard with other European cities. Not extremely large, but comfortable. Would like to have had tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Had a small lift, but with no suitcases, used the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it's all true”
Reviews.Author: jimmygold79
Reviews.Content: You can reserve at Hotel de Varenne. No doubt about it, it's all true. Believe me we had a fantastic time there. The staff is extremely polite and friendly and the decoration is superb. Look no further this is an hidden gem at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, well situated, clean, centrally located small hotel”
Reviews.Author: socalmommyof4
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for my first trip to Paris. I came with my 11 year old daughter. The hotel is very clean. Also very small, situated in a residential area in the 7th arrondisement. Free internet access is provided - ask the concierge for the password. It offers breakfast - either "petit dejuner" which is coffee or tea, juice, breads and jam, or a larger breakfast with eggs, toast and fruit (both for an extra charge) Our room was small by American standards, but all we really needed. We stayed in room 27, equipped with 2 twin beds, small closet, mini-fridge, safe, TV, AIR CONDITIONING, and large bathroom with bath, sink, and stocked with towels, washcloths, water glasses, hand soap, shower gel, shampoo and lotion. Apparently, there are larger rooms, as a family of 4 is staying here as well. Across the street there is a small grocery store, and laundry / dry cleaner. Down the street is a lovely fruit shop and also a yummy bakery. Also in the same block are a pharmacy, and 2 banks with cash machines. Many good cafes and restaurants within 5 - 10 minute walk. 5 minute walk to the Invalides Metro stop so very easy to take Metro transport almost anywhere. (Get a Paris Visite pass at the station for the number of days you will be there and you won't have to buy a ticket for every trip on the Metro. If you plan to leave the central city, get one for zones 1-6, otherwise zones 1-3 will do.) Staff was very friendly, and the concierges at the front desk all spoke English passably well. The hotel is VERY reasonably priced for Paris. The neighborhood is quiet, and safe. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for a decent value in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: cmtsch
Reviews.Content: I had low expectations of Parisian hotels based on everything I had read--and the fact that I don't like hotels as a general rule--but this one really was a great find. The rooms were very spacious and clean, the bathrooms new and very modern, service was good (we got to switch rooms because the people upstairs were loud), computer/internet available, and the location was great. There is some noise from the street in the morning, so a room in the back would be preferable, and the beds are slabs, but otherwise a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Close to great, but...”
Reviews.Author: xoxoxo2010
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel, Charming courtyard, great bathrooms, perfect location, high-speed wifi. Two service-related issues that would make it even better: 1) Get "Do not disturb" signs for the doors, so housekeeping doesn't come knocking at the wrong time; and 2) Have a breakfast buffet instead of full service, or at least add another server. I sat and waited...and waited...and waited...for the one server just to clear the finished breakfast dishes in front of me from the previous guest. She cleared the table next to mine, even though no one was sitting there, but ignored the mess in front of me! So I asked for a menu, thinking she thought they were my dishes. Still no dish removal, let alone a cup of coffee. I finally gave up and left. Since it was a Sunday morning, nothing else was open. Here's a tip: buy something yummy the day before from one of the many nearby markets and cafes and have it for breakfast instead. It'll be far cheaper than the hotel breakfast, too. I had a leftover sandwich, which saved the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mikeny12
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time there> Everything was perfect> We enjoyed very much the excellent service>We will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: DreadPirateMo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel de Varenne while vacationing in France. The hotel is centrally located and an easy walk to most major sights in Paris. The staff are great, friendly greetings and willing to help you with whatever you need. The rooms are nice but not extravagant. The walls are a little thin but fortunately we had good neighbors. Free wireless internet. For the money it was a great value. Also has a grocery store right across the street and two bakeries a few doors down which is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: swanee27
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the Hotel De Varenne after reading the reviews on TA and I have to say we were not disappointed. The hotel has a lovely setting and its charming ambience adds to the pleasure of being in enchanting Paris. The courtyard is exactly as the photos depict it and although the weather was cool we used it to have a picnic with supplies we got from the supermarket across the road (we had had a big lunch). The location of the hotel can't be beaten, it is within walking distance of many of the attractions, It is also a quiet area where you'll see many locals making their way to & from work, school etc. You truly get a sense of Parisian life, I have to say that if you have not been to Paris before do not believe that the French are arrogant, we found them to be so friendly and charming , everyone we dealt with in this beautiful city would go out of there way to help us. I love Paris and would hope to return and if I do I would be more than happy to stay at Hotel De varenne.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunlopgibraltar
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience in this hotel and we would recommend it to everybody looking for a small and pleasant place to stay in Paris. Our room was perfectly clean and of good size. The staff is very polite and friendly, they can give you all the informations tourists need. We appreciated the breakfast taken in our room at no extra charge. Very good value and good service.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AlphaFlyer
Reviews.Content: To begin, this property is a wonderful value if you're planning on trying to stay in Paris at an affordable rate. We paid roughly $200 USD per night and stayed here for two nights. The rooms are clean. The bathrooms are nice. The staff are very nice, if not particularly chatty (and all speak English). I feel a little bad saying that's a perk but it is- my French is just barely good enough to communicate basic needs to a hotel. A word about the breakfast: It's a little underwhelming. The baguettes are fine. The pastries are so-so. Consider going to the patisserie next door. However, if you're a coffee-drinking American like my girfriend and I are (read: you need a good amount of coffee), overall I think the 10 euros is actually a pretty good deal. You get a pot with four cups of coffee. Anywhere else you'll pay 4.50 euro per cup. So it's actually a good value as far as the coffee is concerned. I think the hotel should consider at least adding some fresh fruit to the breakfast. I'm sure this would be a relatively marginal cost. Overall the room was fine, if a little tired. A word of note: the double bed room with the "bath" is not a standard bath (at least as I know them as an American). It's a bathtub with a shower head thing on a hose. In other words you must sit in the tub and wash yourself. My girfriend felt it was a bit like being in a Degas painting. For two nights it was fine but if you have an aversion to this I would consider getting a room with a shower. The location is excellent! Don't expect to find any cheap food nearby. But make sure to head to Ampelos (across the street and a couple blocks to the left upon exiting) if you like wine! The neighborhood is wonderful. Head to the other side of Invalides and down Rue St. Dominique for a plethora of great restaurants. While we were there, the hotel was doing a lot of painting. I didn't really mind it that much, but the signage wasn't very good. Twice I got paint on myself (fortunately not on my clothes) before I had an opportunity to read or be told about the wet paint. If you are a claustrophobe, beware of the elevator. It is the smallest elevator ever.!You can scarcely fit one person plus their luggage in it. The internet is free but very slow. Overally, good stay. Great room rate. Friendly staff. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: sam37Boston
Reviews.Content: I do not understand previous reviewer we had a very good time at Hotel de Varenne. Our room was perfectly clean and very comfortable including the bed. Soap and shampoo smell really good and are sufficiently provided. We appreciated particularly the breakfast served in the charming little garden outside the garden. The staff is polite and smilling, we did not experience any problem with the service. We can say it was perfectly matching our expectations. The value is excellent : only 139 Euro for a double room with bath. We warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dhac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel over Valentines weekend. The staff were very helpful the hotel was very clean. The rooms were typical Paris sized "cosy" but ideal as we didnt spend much time in the hotel. Good location with a RER link to airport with only 1 change. Walking distance to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Go back over and over”
Reviews.Author: rwkcyn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on many occasions and have always been most impressed. Central to most sites but quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Layover spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JonathonNealesteine
Reviews.Content: Whenever traveling to Paris I like to try a different area, De Varenne is in the Invalides, Eiffel Tower Quarter, but borders St. Germain des Pres and Luxembourgh Quarter. Quiet area, lots of shops, caves and restaurants. Easy walk to Metro, Musee Guimet, Musee d' Orsay and the Louvre. Staff was great and room and bath very comfortable and clean. If I could offer suggestions to management, I would say: Add Internet Wi-Fi connection, keep rooms freshly painted. There was only one plugin I could find for charging, so I had to be diligent with switching devices. Throughout France you can trust the hotel rating system, however in Paris you have to be careful. This hotel exceeds its rating. Breakfast was great! I can't believe how the French can make breads...why can't any other country?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: anutaNY
Reviews.Content: The location was great, close to train/RER station, walking distance to many attractions such as Louvre, musee d'Orsay, St-Germain, Dome Church, Musee D'Armee, Jardin de Luxembourg, and pretty much everything else (depending on how much walking you are willing to do). The hotel itself was very clean, with nicely-sized rooms. Our room was on the second floor and it was pretty noisy. I could hear people from the reception area, every little noise from the rooms next to us, plus the morning and evening traffic from the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis inParis”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan_9
Reviews.Content: A great hotel ,in a very quiet location yet near the main attractions by foot or the metro near by.The front desk staff were very efficient and friendly,there was a real feeling of home about the hotel. A reviewer said to request room 42 as it had view of the Tower,it is room 41 that has the view,the room we stayed in!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelproNYC56
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful when our train was delayed. The hotel is well-situated on a quiet street in Saint- Germain-des Pres and close to the Musee Rodin (at the street corner) , l'Orangerie, Musee d'Orsay, the Louvre and Les Invalides. There is a metro (Varenne) right around the corner. The rooms are attractive and the hotel is very charming. There are restaurants and bakeries in the immediate area, in case you want to get croissants and cafe creme for breakfast or dinner close to the hotel. I would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Superb location”
Reviews.Author: janetravel56
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in this hotel for five days in december and enjoyed it very much. Hotel de Varenne is excellent and the location can't be beaten. We particularly appreciated the comfort of our rooms and the cleanliness of the bathrooms. Everything is cosy and charming, the staff is friendly and helpful. The only thing we regret is to be obliged to go back home, but we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tom-n-Charl
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Paris for valentines day for 5 days to stay at hotel de varenne. The hotel was in a perfect location in a upper class part of paris. it is close to government buildings and embassies. the national assemble is just at the bottom of the road. there are lots of bakeries flower and fruit shops around the hotel and some very good restaurants. if you do go to anywhere in paris we highly...very very highly recommend going to a restaturant called Le Borbon next to the national assemble. it doesnt look like much from the outside but it is the best food we've ever eaten. i think the resturant is over 100 years old. there is also a vietnamese restaurant over the road from the hotel and it wasn't too nice but was decent enough. the hotel doesnt offer many services like a pool, bar, restaurant etc. however if you are travelling to paris to have the parisian experiance you should not be loking for such ammenities anyway! the hotel is prestine and the serice is excellant. you can get breakfast in bed or in the dining room. The rooms were well furnished. We stayed in room 42, when we arrived we opened the blinds hoping for a nice view and were greeted by the eiffel tower. perfect view, request room 42! no faults, very cheap for what you get booking through their website.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: cristinayucatan
Reviews.Content: We have been staying with my husband at hotel de varenne during 10 days in november and we had a wonderful time. The service is excellent and our room was extremely comfortable with very good matress and nice decoration. The bathroom is clean and well renovated. The staff is very polite and always willing to please. The area is quiet and safe and it has many good restaurants nearby indicated by the receptionist Beatrix who is really helpful and speaks good english. We will be happy to return if we go back to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: david589
Reviews.Content: We had a real good time in this hotel during our stay in Paris. Our room was superb, good size and nicely decorated. The owner took time to advise us about restaurants, sightseeing and even called an efficient doctor when my wife did not fell well. We will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: saqui
Reviews.Content: We had a real nice time during our stay in Paris at Le Varenne. The staff is helpfull and polite. Evrything is clean and cosy. The real plus is the breakfast, so good, particularly the omelettes. The location is superb near the Invalides and close to the metro. Our room was not that big but reasonable size according to european standards. A special thank to Beatrix for helping us with our restaurant reservations. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service”
Reviews.Author: bobby451
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in this hotel with my family and appreciated very much the very good value and the perfect service of the kind staff. Everything is done to make you fell at home. Our rooms were large enough and spotlessly clean. The breakfasts are excellent and served in the cosy garden when the sun shines. We will never forget our trip in this beautiful city. The location of the hotel is prefect, close to many touristic places. Definitely a place to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Rest was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Townsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Varenne for 3 nights recently. We liked the location, it is very centrally located and you can walk to all major Paris attractions, some in 10 minutes or less (Orsay, Rodin and Napoleon's Tomb / Invalides). Our only complaint about the location is that there isn't much going on in the immediate area so you may want to walk 10 minutes or so over to Rue Cler or Saint Germain to eat where there are many more restaurants and activity (or stay in those areas if thats what you're coming to Paris for). Rooms were a little dated, but certainly clean and well maintained. One thing we found a little odd was that the hotel asked you to leave your key with the front desk when you left the hotel (we didn't run into this elsewhere in Europe, but maybe its common over there). Not a huge deal, but we ended up waiting for a couple minutes once to get our room key when the one front desk person was helping some other guests out (making tea for them in the back), which was a little annoying. Certainly a decent place to stay, especially if you'd like a quiet neighbourhood within walking distance to all sights.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem of a Paris hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SallyWilmingtonDE
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Varenne is truly a gem of a small hotel, tucked away off a charming courtyard on a quiet street. It couldn't be more convenient for many of the major tourist attractions yet is also well situated for rambling walks around untouristy Paris neighborhoods. The staff is a bit reserved but friendly and helpful. Our room was definitely adequate in size by Paris standards and meticulously clean. The view of the vine covered wall with residential courtyards on either side was delightful. We loved opening the windows and hearing no street noise (though it can be fun watching Paris come alive in the morning). Our only regret is that we didn't discover this hotel on one of our many previous visits to this magical city. Recommendations from us have already gone to traveling friends from many corners of the world. Hopefully, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - quiet”
Reviews.Author: HMBoston
Reviews.Content: Noise from the street is not a problem because rooms look onto central courtyard. The rooms were fine. Maybe I am getting used to staying in nice hotels, but I hate polyester bed covers with polyester/cotton blend sheets. Bathroom nice and in good shape.I found the staff a little chilly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kat1790
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Varenne on several occasions with work and also with family. This trip was with my Mum and Sisters and we were really pleased with the hotel. It's very clean and the hotel rooms were a reasonable size for Paris! We found it a good spot for sight seeing - easy access to the metro and also walking distance to St Germain and the Eiffel Tower. The staff are friendly and helpful. If you're lucky you'll be able to enjoy breakfast in the courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: tobias963
Reviews.Content: We spent a all week at the Hotel de Varenne beginning of august. This has been a wonderfull experience we will never forget. The rooms are cosy and spotlessly clean. The staff is incredible and always willing to please; The breakfast is excellent and served in the nice garden. But what is incredible is the value : all this for only 135 Euro a night is really amazing. A place to remember and to recommend to everyone;

Reviews.Title: “Charming courtyard for outside breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Grizza
Reviews.Content: We were lucky with the weather and had breakfast outside each day. Our room overlooked the courtyard so there was little to no noise at all from traffic. We were even able to leave the windows open if we didn't want the sound or airconditioning. I hadn't appreciated most restaurants would be closed in August ( not that I could change our wedding anniverary date !) but the hotel was able to recommend a nice Bistro within a nice 10 min walk, just past Invalides. Early evening each day we relaxed in the sun with a drink at one of the cafes in the Jardin de Tuileries (8.5E a pint ,mind!) Try lunch at the Musee Orsay too , just up the road - their special was just that. Overall great location for our first trip to Paris for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: York_experience
Reviews.Content: We booked a deal through Eurostar and chose this hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor. We went for our first romantic break as a couple and I have to say that the whole experience was a fantastic one! Going for the first time on Eurostar was great, no stress at all! The hotel itself was just what we'd expected : a nice little charming hotel. We booked the deluxe room which was absolutey wonderful. The bed was so confortable, we wanted to bring it home. The reception desk was always very nice, courteous and happy to help, even with our poor french. We are happy to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice And Cosy Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avidfisherman25
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time during our stay in Paris. This hotel is a little gem hidden in the center of the capital. Everything is clean and nicely decorated. We enjoied breakfast every day in the little garden, it was a grest time. The city is marvelous and the staff helped us to discover the main sites. Our room was really cosy and spotless. We hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: comoros1
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Paris a week ago and appreciated the good service of le Varenne. Everything is made to make you feel at home what is most enjoyable when you arrive in a city you have never been before. The comfort of the rooms is perfect and the location suberp. The rate is really reasonable and already plan to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Quality Hotel and a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TomNH9
Reviews.Content: About six years ago my wife and I were walking from the Rodin Museum up rue de Bourgogne when we passed a gated archway that opened onto a courtyard filled with greenery. The street gave no suggestion that such an inviting location even existed and that surprise discovery of this charming hotel led us to book a room there the following year. We have returned twice since then ... most recently at the end of a month long European trip in July 2009. We have stayed in the standard room with a shower, the standard room with a bath, and the superior room. We "managed" in the smaller room but really enjoyed the extra space in the larger rooms. The hotel is extremely well managed and clean. The biggest treat for us, is breakfast in the courtyard. The price may seem high but it is below the average for hotels of this quality in Paris ... and it is possible to simply have a coffee if you want. The atmosphere and service provide a great start to a day exploring Paris. For eating, we suggest Le Comptoir du Relais in the 6th on Carrefour de L'Odeon which has a menu with a large selection of excellent choices for lunch and early dinner (not just prix fix) and GOU, 47 avenue de la Motte Picquet, where you can buy "gourmet carry out" for a picnic. We already are planning our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in quiet street, good location”
Reviews.Author: Yggdrasil98
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Hotel de Varenne in January. I wanted a quiet hotel near to the Louvre and within walking distance of many sights. The location is great, literally around the corner from Rodin Museum, and brisk walk to many attractions. Small supermarket stores, and market fairly close. Convenient for the Metro, though we walked everywhere - it was freezing, but not wet. The street is very quiet and peaceful and we really enjoyed observing the street. The 7th Arr is a nice area, and this hotel was small enough to be personal, but offered privacy too. Compimentary WIFI was a nice bonus. We did not eat here as we felt the prices a little high, and had just had a cruise so didn't need a lot of food! Public areas including dining area very elegant and welcoming. We liked walking in the door, exhausted after a day in Paris. The only downside was that we were on the first floor, and directly above us there seemed to be a ladies in high heels and children moving furniture each evening!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with central location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cgraversen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and I would like to pass on the recommendation to a fellow traveller. It is a cozy hotel close to the Rodin Museum and Invalides so it is a very central location. It is a small hotel and the rooms are cozy or more correctly small. The staff is friendly and it is close to two metro stations - Varenne and Invalides.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneParisvisite
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Versailles for one night before leaving to the Loire Valley and I write my review better now before I forget. We spent a great couple of days in Paris and in the Hotel de Varenne. The location of the hotel in my opinion could not be better. It is a short walk to saint Germain de pres in one direction and a reasonable walk to the Eiffel tower in the opposite way. We found the transport links provided by Invalides station fantastic. The owner of the hotel was very friendly and gave some good tips about the local area.There are lots of nice restaurants in the surrounding streets. The hotel itself is really nice, extremely tastefully decorated. All in all, this was an authentic french experience and we hope our trip will continue like this.

Reviews.Title: “Charm & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: SeraBey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an area that we love so much..rue de Bourgogne. It is on the left bank and in an area with Embassies - so it is very quite, and secure - and several wonderful restaurants - a couple of grocery stores - and it is a 3 min walk to the Rodin museum and about 5 min to Invalides and 15 min walk to Orsay Museum. The hotel has air conditioning (a must in summer for us soft bellied Americans!) - the Hotel de Varnne is nicer than Hotel Palais du Bourbon which we stayed in before (and more expensive), however the room furnishings and and bathroom and atmosphere in the Varenne is worth the difference (no grumpy desk clerks either). Hotel Paris de Varnne - Great garden courtyard - very nicely appointed rooms - but be cautious though that they don't book you into the room with an attic dormer over the bed (ouch! in the middle of the night). Don't pay extra for breakfast as there is an amazing pastry shop down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel”
Reviews.Author: southseabh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel de Varenne and couldn't be more pleased. Our room was small, but most of them in Paris are. It was very tastefully decorated. Our bathroom had separated toilette and shower and this was very convenient. The front desk was very helpful, we couldn't figure out how many languages they speak. They suggested to buy our museum passes at the musee Rodin and this worked out very well. We took the Opentour bus for a sightseeing tour in front of the Invalides, just a couple of minutes off the hotel. We had a great time in Paris and we warmly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EHMkm
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Hotel de Varenne,Paris & we're extremely happy with everything.It's a perfect location to see all the sights of Paris, be prepared for tired feet/legs as it's so close to everything, longest walk Notre Dame & Left Bank @40mins.Nice size room & spotlessly clean, choice of DVD's & news papers at reception, breakfast ok esp.A la carte menu, much better value. Safe & fridge great idea did miss the fact no tea/coffee making facilities as no where to get hot drink after @6pm. Be warned all cafe's etc closed from Fri even -monday morn, so nearest place for food is just @ corner from Musee D'Arme with lovely cafe's on Rue Marbourg-bit expensive for what you get so if you can walk to left bank esp.Rue Andre des Arts near St.Michel Place for great Irish pub Corcoran's(good food & atmosphere,all sports aired & live music at wknds) & loads other cafe's & take out food, much better deal's & locals use also. Shopping at Galleries Lafayette @30mins & easy to find. Nice little jewellery shop on same st as hotel. Great local services as per other reviews. Lovely sun trap spot down by Seine across from the Louvre. Did the Bateau Mouches one evening as treat & it really lived up to expectations, pricey at â‚¬95p.p or â‚¬135p.p but got bottle of sparkling wine, bottle of wine, 5course meal & live music on 21/2 hr cruise. well worth it! Definite for romantic/special occasion. We're sorry to have missed the sundial in action in St.Sulprice on March21st & Dec 21st. It would have been a spectacular sight. Taxi from Palais De Congres to hotel @â‚¬12, to left bank @â‚¬8. All attractions @â‚¬9 & cafe's/restaurants range in price more expensive near the sights. All Parisians eat on the run so join in & take away, loads of little parks to sit in & enjoy the wonderful architecture.Would definitely use this hotel again, perfect for everything!

Reviews.Title: “We have loved our stays at the Hotel de Varenne”
Reviews.Author: leonide
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quiet and inviting, with a friendly and accommodating staff. On our first visit, the moment we entered the courtyard we knew we'd made a good choice. Our greeting at the front desk confirmed our impression. Two metro lines are a short walk away. Nearby attractions, within walking distance, include les Invalides and the Esplanade, the river Seine, Place de la Concorde, Rodin Museum, Neighborhood walks are very inviting. Excellent restaurants abound.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week at the Hotel de Varenne”
Reviews.Author: preacherman1949
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a wonderful week in Paris, staying at the Hotel de Varenne. I have stayed there quite a few times. Like most hotels on the Left Bank the rooms are cosy but beautifully furnished. The service is efficient and charming. You are 5 minutes from the Rodin Museum and the Invalides, and 10 minutes from the Place de la Concorde. Best of all, you are in the middle of the 7th Arrondissement which to me is the most beautiful area in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “First Paris trip”
Reviews.Author: 4happywanderers
Reviews.Content: Hotel Varenne was a great hotel for a second honeymoon and first trip to Paris. My husband and I had a superior room which was very large, comfortable and tasteful. The tub was narrow, but no other complaints. The staff was very helpful in making dinner reservations and answering questions in English. We took full advantage of the nearby metro stop and traveled most places by metro or foot, using only an occasional taxi. We had the continental breakfast a few times (one order fed both of us), but also enjoyed the great bakery just steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't hesitate to return...”
Reviews.Author: LestersAllstars
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel De Varenne, it's in a central location within walking distance of the museums and the Eiffel Tower. Handy for pretty walks along the river. Good area for restaurants. Nice and close to a couple of Metro stops if you want to travel further afield. Nice, clean, well maintained hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. Many thanks for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Greg-Seattle
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant and quiet hotel in an excellent location. If you are looking for exciting in-the-hotel nightlife (bars, discos, lots of flash, etc.) this isn't the hotel for you. Our room was modest, clean, well appointed and very comfortable. The staff was very accommodating to our requests and were very hospitable. I have no idea why anyone would place a review in which they indicate the Varenne is "anti-American." As an American, I found the staff to be friendly regardless of my country of origin. I would disregard the review indicating anti-American sentiments. I recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lucanIreland
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay here on the recommendation of TA. The hotel is in a fantastic location within walking distance of many of the cityâ€™s iconic sites. Rue de Bourgogne is a wonderful street an oasis after a hectic day of sightseeing as well as catering to the more mundane needs i.e.: supermarket across the street,bakerys coffee shops est., est. The hotel reflects all that is marvellous about Paris charming discrete, understated style. The staff were at all times helpful and friendly. The hotel added greatly to a very successful break away for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel / Location”
Reviews.Author: tonxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel de Varenne for three nights on a recent trip to Paris with my fiancÃ©e. Have to say that the hotel is in a lovely area - very safe and calm but nice and close to all the sights. The Eiffel Tower / Invalides is a few mins walk one way, Musee D'Orsay / Louvre / Concorde few mins walk other way - perfect. No need to use the metro too much and nice area for a stroll out in the evening to bars etc. The price for the room @ 157 euros per night is about right I think as the room itself was not massive but it was more than sufficient for two people. The bathroom however was big with plenty of space and a brilliant shower. The room had a flatscreen TV with plenty of channels, safe and also (something that proved a god send) A FRIDGE!!!! Had initially wanted to be nearer the Latin Quarter when planned the trip - but we prefer it around the Varenne arrondissement now as it is far more sophisitcated and pleasant . All of the staff were polite and efficient. We had the Eurostar tunnel closue during our stay meaning we had to book flights back instead of using our Eurostar tickets - staff were helpful and assissted with making these arrangements. Cannot comment on breakfast as we chose to wander to the Eiffel Tower with a coffee (when eventually found somewhere that did a take-away cafe au lait!?!) and viennoiserie in the morning but the little courtyard at the hotel is a lovely feature. Try LE BISTROT DE PALAIS on the same steet as Hotel de Varenne - charming little restaurant full of character. Also PASCO on Boulevard de La Tour Maubourg - amazing food and atmosphere. Avoid THOUMIEUX on rue saint dominique - terrible service and unfriendly which was disappointing as every guide book recommends it?!? Was without doubt the worst restaurant of the trip. All in all Hotel de Varenne is a wonderful hotel that we will be recommending to friends and deffinately visiting again. Hotels in Paris can be a nightmare - Hotel de Varenne however is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel de Varenne”
Reviews.Author: vacation200807
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful and cute hotel with great staff. The rooms were immaculate, the breakfast was great and the little courtyard so nice. Location was quiet, close to Embassys, federal buildings but also Museum Rodin and Hotel De Invalides were around the corner from the Hotel as well as the Metro. I would recommend this hotel anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: ArtsyGalBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short stay in Paris. I chose the Hotel de Varenne based on positive TripAdvisor reviews and am now adding our own rave review. The location is wonderful, close to two subway stops and a range of museums and sites. The Rodin museum is just around the corner and Napolean's tomb is a brief walk. The Musee d'Orsay is a subway stop away, but we walked it; the Eiffel Tower is also an easy walk. We booked a triple since our teenage son traveled with us and the room was comfortable, a double bed and single bed, and quite spacious for Paris. The room was well furnished, quite tasteful with a stylish French flair, and my son enjoyed the very large flat screen TV. (We didn't bring our laptop, but internet is available and our son was a frequent user.) The bathrooms were spotless and modern. Our third floor room had two windows which overlooked the flowered courtyard. There is a small elevator. The owners were warm and made us feel welcome. The owners kept our luggage for us the day we arrived before check-in and even the day we left--nice touch. We walked each day to Rue Cler for breakfast, and there are local fruit stands and bakeries on the street. Some fine restaurants including La Maupertu are a short walk near Invalides. I would highly recommend this delightful hotel and will definitely stay there when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded exptations”
Reviews.Author: bonsoir_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect, exactly what we wanted,the room was spotless and tastefully decorated, the staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were good. It was located within walking distance of the major attractions such as The louvre, Eiffel Tower, Invalides and many more. All the restaurants recommended by the hotel were excellent and all within a few minutes walk. Try Tante Marguerite you will not be disappointed. Look forward to staying again on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “anti-American”
Reviews.Author: DonWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location and the facilities offered are very nice. However, the owner, Jean-Marc, has an anti-American streak that is quite off-putting. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: roryeverett
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was brilliant! We had excellent service all thanks to the people [receptionist, porters, maids etc] . Everyone was very helpful and polite, who also all spoke english which was very useful to us as our french is not the best. Our room was very nice and immaculate, [cleaned and tidied after we came back from our days out also]. The Hotel in my opinion is worthy of more than 3 stars. The location of Hotel de Varenne was spot on too, we did not bother using the metro/buses etc as all the sights were within walking distance. We will definitley be staying here again when we next vist Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmw_8
Reviews.Content: Great location for the hotel, close to all the major landmarks. Skip the breakfast that you have to pay extra for and watch out for the extra cost of the wi-fi. Having said that though this is a great place to stay, a great comfortable bed and updated furnature and bathroom. I would stay here again. Located in a quite block in the government district and the updated double pane window cut out any moped's and cars on the street. A great little courtyard that is a good place to kick back with a bottle of wine from the market across the street and relax after a day of running around the city seeing all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: UK352
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location. I'm used to big cities in the States where you expect to be mugged on every streetcorner but staying at de Varenne was a very comforting experience since it's in the Embassy District and there are cops everywhere. It's still within walking distance of a few important sites and other stuff you can reach by metro. There's a good bakery nearby with awesome French desserts but it kept some odd (=lazy) hours. No complaints whatsoever about the room itself or the staff. We requested a room with a view and were surprised we actually got one. It was really nice to look at the lit up Eiffel tower from our bed after a long day of sightseeing. Just what we were hoping our stay in Paris would be like.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel De Varenne!”
Reviews.Author: MomandSonMay08
Reviews.Content: My 20-year-old son and I have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel de Varenne, May 5-May 11. We chose it on the recommendation of friends, and were very pleased. The hotel is in a quiet area and our room overlooked the courtyard, so we were able to sleep with windows open. Our twin room with a shower was very clean, very comfortable, recently renovated, and ample space for our needs. The hotel staff, from first greeting until our departure, was first rate and very helpful. Most of our dealings were with Beatrix and Soultan. Prior to our arrival they arranged reservations for a day-trip to the Normandy and D-Day areas. They assisted with our laptop computer, and arranged for a shuttle back to the airport on the final morning. We chose to have breakfast there each morning, and it was a great start to the day. I ordered the fabulous basket of breads and jellies, juice and a pot of coffee, while my hungry son frequently ordered "a la carte" to get omelettes or eggs. The metro stop Varenne is very close by, along with a public telephone if you want to use a phone-card. Our most fun experience on the trip was an afternoon tour of Paris by segway, by Fat Bike Tours. Our "mom and son" trip was a great success, thanks in part to the Hotel de Varenne and staff. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Varenne”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoChris
Reviews.Content: We just recently returned from a week stay in Paris and I felt compelled to share this review of Hotel de Varenne. Overall, I would rate the hotel as excellent and a very good value. Highlights: - Beautiful, well kept rooms, nice decor - Great bathroom (big, remodeled) - Big operable windows - Fridge - Flat panel TV - Free internet (WiFi) - Decent size rooms (from researching other properties and reviews, probably better than average for Paris) - Great location on a quiet street - easy walk to Metro (5 minutes or less); 15 minutes to Rue Cler neighborhood; 15 minutes to heart of Sant Germain de Pres; 5 minutes to Rodin museum; 5 minutes to Invalides - Immediate area has lots of small shops and is charming We really couldn't have asked for more and I would definitely recommend this hotel. From San Francisco, CA

Reviews.Title: “A Trip To Remember”
Reviews.Author: EZorangee
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel de Varrenne was among one of our top travel experiences. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of all the main attractions within the city. During the evening, we took advantage of many of the great restaurants also within walking distance of the hotel. As for the hotel itself, it met all of our requirements of a friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and wonderful ambience. We will surely return for our next experience to Paris to the Hotel de Varrenne and would certainly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: magimix
Reviews.Content: Well located, friendly hotel. Would probably be four stars if it had more facilities. Rooms clean and well decorated. The 10 Euro breakfast was a good start to the day and would only save about 2 Euros if you chose to eat at a local patisserie. Within walking distance of many attractiions and would have no hesitation in staying there again if we re-visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiredpa43
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at this absolutely charming French hotel. Everything about it was excellent and it certainly deserved a higher rating than three stars. Our superior double room was large, with a beautiful bathroom including a separate toilet. It overlooked the lovely small french street and it was great to watch the world go by. The double glazing was most effective. The reception and breakfast staff were most helpful and the small courtyard would have been a perfect place to sit had the weather been warmer. When we return to Paris, which I am sure we will, we will certainly go back to Hotel de Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay at the Hotel de Varenne”
Reviews.Author: sfvr
Reviews.Content: A quaint little hotel, very well located. The staff were friendly and attentive. The room was quite large, and the hotel readily supplied a spare cot for our 4 year old. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Seasoned travellers can still find a GEM!”
Reviews.Author: seniorbeachgoers
Reviews.Content: Two Couples just returned from a great visit to Paris that was even more impressive by staying at the hotel de Varenne. The hotel was ready for us and every day gave us superior service from the petit de jeuner to directions to sights and restaurants and help with our rental car to depart Paris. The day receptionist went out of her way to provide us with help that has left us with a good feeling about Paris and Parisians. All were friendly and spoke English expertly. We recommend this hotel and this location for your French experience. It was quiet , something we appreciated more each day. Thank you all for a special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Paris”
Reviews.Author: vacationAugusta_Ga
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice neighborhood. Quite comfortable rooms and quiet in the evenings. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: pedlar
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hotel de Varenne. Our room overlooked the small courtyard and was very clean. The double bed was extremely comfortable. The shower was good and powerful with soaps and shampoo provided together with warm towels from the heated towel rail. A flat screen TV with satellite channels completed the facilities. Breakfast was the usual continental with freshly baked baguette, pastries and preserves, fruit juice and tea or coffeee. The down side is the dining room is quite small and can become crowded. The only reason we did not rate as 'excellent' is because we waited 15 minutes sitting at an uncleared table before clearing it ourselves and getting the manager's attention for some service. The previous day we had excellent service so maybe we were just unlucky on this occasion. This hotel is ideally situated for walking to the usual Paris sights, Eiffel Tower, Place de la Concorde, even 'les grands magasins'. As this was our first visit to Paris we took advantage of L'Open Tour, an open top bus tour. We opted for the two day ticket, giving four different tours, to orientate ourselves. Unfortunately, the weather was so cold that we spent the tours inside rather than on the open upper deck. This ticket was good value at 29 Euro as against 26 Euro for a one day pass. We also tried the 'Batobus' a river boat cruise, again with the two day option. This was a very relaxed way to cruise the Seine, in a totally enclosed glass cruise boat. We travelled via Eurostar which was quick and comfortable. Buying a 'carnet' of ten tickets for the Metro was a bit excessive as we only used four because walking and the bus tours were so convenient. We will certainly visit Paris again, and will probably use the same hotel, as the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lesleyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Varenne for 2 nights over Valentines in a deluxe room. room was lovely- just as on website. Setting good too- pretty courtyard which would be ideal for summer. Good location- close to Varenne and Invalides Metro- easily walkable to Eiffel Tower- 15 mins- and would be walking distance to Louvre too but feet too sore! Lots of nice restaurants in the surrounding streets. Very authentic french experience. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great couple of days at the Varenne”
Reviews.Author: lw05jjm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great couple of days in Paris in which the hotel contributed a substantial amount to the enjoyment. We originally booked the Varenne so that we could be within walking distance of Pont Alexandre III as we had an engagement in this area on the Friday night. As we only had a couple of days we concentrated our efforts mostly in the 7 eme Arrondissement, spending a sunny morning on the Champ de Mars and we had a fantastic dinner at La Petit Chaise on Rue de Granelle. If we wanted to go into the centre of town we found the transport links provided by Invalides station fantastic with all directions covered. The hotel itself was a real treat the concierge was extremely polite and helpful on both arrival and departure. The room was large and extremely tastefully decorated as well as being spotless. The bathroom was equally large and also spotlessly clean. The T.V. was massive, but unless you are really strong at french you will probably struggle, although watching the Simpson's in french was excellent. All in all this hotel exceeded my expectations and if I need to stay in S.W. Paris again I will definitely be using the Hotel de Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel in a Central Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SaintDominique
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, small, intimate hotel, in a beautiful part of Paris. Its an easy access to the metro and easy walk to many good restaurants, shops and tourist locations.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: bogert
Reviews.Content: Charming boutique hotel on the south bank walking distance away from main tourist areas but far enough to feel homely. A number of local shops chemist, grocer etc cafes/restaurants on the doorstep including a cash till. Lovely hotel it is recently refurbished and fresh. I stayed in a standard room with shower - shower was great which is always a big relief in europe. Continental breakfast was included, its basic but generous and we love french breads. A la carte is also available and its well priced. The management and staff are friendly and their english is very good they made great recommendations for eating out and also booked taxis etc. This hotel will be our regular when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TRIPITACA
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a gem. Its location is fantastic for all of Paris and the bits tourists want to see. Arrive in the evening at Metro stop Varenne and see the Eiffel Tower Sparkle. Walk around the corner, past the Rodin Museum and you are there. Great little bistro just up the road as well. Visit the local flower and speciality shops in the morning. The hotel staff are really friendly and speak 100% perfect English. Good quality rooms with TV/SAT/DVD, Piping hot water, nice and quiet. Immaculately clean and just undergoing an outside repaint to spruce up ready for the summer season. The little courtyard is a great place for Breakfast, and they are not mean with the Croissants and Coffee :-) But don't tell everyone, as it is too good a secret to share !

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and yet homey!”
Reviews.Author: BillAnniston_AL
Reviews.Content: Booked directly with the hotel at their website. Excellent staff, simple but elegant breakfast served on porcelan, small yet beautiful marble bathroom, very quiet and a fantastic location. Like staying at The George V at a steal of a price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel many times”
Reviews.Author: george027
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel near Invalides and Rodin Museum. Have stayed there a number of times and enjoyed it each time. Would stay again. In Spring and Summer, enjoy having breakfast in their open patio

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: namcy
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel de Varenne. We were there for two nights, December 17 and 18, 2007. We stayed in a "superior double" on the second floor. On our previous visit, we were given the superior double on the third floor, which is more spacious, but we were very happy with this room, as well. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Orsay Museum, and very quiet. There are also two bakeries and mini-markets near the hotel. The staff was very professional and courteous. We checked in on a bitterly cold night, at around 8PM. They had our key ready for us, so it only took us a minute to get to the room, which was well heated. The room itself was clean and well-appointed, and the bathroom was spacious and spotlessly cleaned everyday. We also enjoyed the Continental breakfast. At 10 Euors, it is a little pricey but filling and convenient. We will be staying at the Varenne again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Varenne”
Reviews.Author: ecantibes
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 2 nights in October on a stop over in Paris. We were very happy with our accommodations. It was reasonably priced for Paris and all the people who manned the front desk were very helpful and kind and made our trip more enjoyable. The hotel is quiet and our room was clean. The bathroom was small but not unexpectedly so. The hotel is also in a terrific location for walking. We had a great time and I would definitely return to this hotel. Belated thanks to all the people at the Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasant place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: SilverFly
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in a great location with easy access to the Metro (Varenne station) and to left bank sights. Musee D'Orse, Rodin Museum, Eiffel Tower, St Germain, San Sulpice are all within easy walking distance. The hotel is on a quiet street with a small market, excellent artisan bakery, and ATM all only a few doors away. The rooms are obsessively clean, and understated in their decoration...none of that flocked wallpaper. The whole environment and the welcome are pleasant without exception.

Reviews.Title: “De Varenne is a very good hotel - and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Tompell
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Varenne, Les Invalides, Paris We stayed for just over a week at this very pleasant family owned hotel. The room and bathroom were lovely, and the services very efficient. The staff went out of their way to be helpful: arranging with us our train travel to Brussels; pointing out metro services (we were en greve at the time - but it worked nevertheless!); and being generally pleasant and helpful without being in anyway overbearing. They provide breakfast - and the coffee and morning breads are just delicious. The hotel is on a quiet sreet with great cafes and restaurants, and a depaneur/boulangerie so you can pick up bread and cheese and a bottle of wine if you don't feel like eating out. They also have a little courtyard - which would be fabulous in the warmer months. Finally the location is great. Just round the corner from the Concorde and really accessible to all one might want to do in Paris - on foot, in order to walk off all that delicious morning bread. We had a lovely time at the Hotel de Varenne. Roberta Ellis and Ken Beeson

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottyjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Varenne (we being 4 young at heart women!) for 3 nights in November. The area is quiet and handy for the metro-about 5 mins walk from Les invalides in one direction and Solferino in the other. Room was fine average for a city hotel Nice bathroom and good shower and very clean. There is a small outside garden would be nice in summer. The reception staff were a bit slow -an older gentleman who took a while to understand that we didn't all have the same name, however he was very pleasant. I'd advise going out for breakfast as the hotel does not have a proper restaurant and where they serve breakfast is tiny and you have to queue. There are plenty of nearby cafes just past les Invalides. Overall a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AvidIndianTraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the active city center, just south of the Seine. It is in the center of the Eiffel Tower on the west and Notre Dame on the east (both a 20 min walk on either side), with all major attractions like the Champs Elysees, Louvre, Musee Dorsay in between. It is close to the majore Invalides station which has the RER C line to Versailles. Rooms were new and refurbished. Staff extrememly helpful - helped us book our airport coach, lent us a lonely planet guide to Paris in English, etc

Reviews.Title: “Good long weekend break”
Reviews.Author: francophile47
Reviews.Content: Extremely well placed a few hundred yards from Assemble National and Les Invalides and their Metro stations. Also close to Air France terminal. Quiet neighbourhood. Hotel is an old courtyard house. Rooms overlooking the courtyard are quiet. Well equiped with fridge, LCD TV etc. Bathroom appeared recently refurbished. Bed comfortable. Staff helpful, for example preparing room in one hour when we arrived early at 10.30 am, and booking taxis etc. Be carefull though, prebooked taxi was 3 times as expensive compared with one flagged down for the same trip. Breakfast is fine, but the room is small and there can be waits if several people arrive at the same time. Range of nationalities in the clients with a majority american. A quiet pleasant hotel. Will use again. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaVoyager
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for six nights in January 2007 and could not have been happier. We chose the Hotel Varenne based on TripAdvisor reviews, since we did not see it in any guidebooks. The location is fantastic. We were able to walk to the Musee d'Orsay, Saint Germain des Pres, Le Bon Marche, Eiffel Tower, as well as numerous locations on the Right Bank including the Louvre and even the Arc de Triomphe. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is quite upscale, and is full of bakeries, small markets and other shops that cater to locals, not tourists (which we saw as a plus since we saw the real Paris). Rooms were a tad on the small side, but were very pleasantly decorated, quiet, and very comfortable. The staff was fantastic, and helped with booking restaurant reservations, since our French is lousy. The breakfast in the morning consisted of pastries and breads, and was a wonderful way to start the day. Overall, we really felt at home at the Hotel Varenne, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: MikkiDennis
Reviews.Content: We had no idea where to stay when we began planning our trip to Paris. But just in time, our local newspaper published a full-page story on small Paris hotels that were economically priced. After reviewing all of the recommendations, the De Varenne seemed the right choice for us......and it was! When we arrived and walked through the quaint courtyard leading to the sliding doors to the lobby, we were certain that our decision was perfect. Our room overlooked the sweet courtyard where we spent every evening sharing a bottle of wine and meeting others from around the world who were doing the same thing. The hotel is one block from the Rodin Museum, a short walk to the Invalides where tourists can catch the on/off tour buses, and is very conveniently located near shops, restaurants, pasterries, and markets. The staff was so very kind and helpful. We look forward to returning one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff at Good, Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bowlerboy77
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights at this hotel and must say that the staff is remarkable. Dealt with many of them and everyone was willing to help with any request and never made me feel like I was imposing. In fact, when I had a problem with my room they had the owner/director respond to me personally and his response was courteous, professional and more than satisfactory. If you do want to eat at the hotel I would recommend the a la carte menu for breakfast as a better buy than the continental breakfast. As someone who wants to see the city all day but then be able to sleep at night, this hotel was ideally located in an extremely quiet neighborhood. If you want nightlife, you can find it elsewhere, but come back to the Varenne for a peaceful night's sleep. But if you like to sleep with your windows open as I do, be warned that like most European hotels there are no screens and we did battle mosquitoes a couple of nights. The size of the room was servicable and the bathroom was very big by any standard. The bathroom could have used a little sprucing up; some cracks/peeling in the paint due to the steam from the shower (no shower curtain or enclosure). The housekeeping service was attentive with one exception - had to ask for more soap and shampoo; they weren't replaced as a matter of form. The Paris metro is sensational and the hotel is located very close to the Varenne metro stop. Also an incredibly short walk to the Rodin Museum. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower more than once. As for dining, you can take Rue Grenelle over toward the Eiffel Tower to find several wonderful options starting at Boulevard de la Tour Marbourg and beyond, which we did practically every night. Right on the same street as the hotel, just a few steps away are a bank, small supermarket, fresh fruit stand, bakery, dry cleaner and pharmacy and around the corner is a post office - all your needs are covered. I think it added immensely to stay at this small, boutique style hotel than a major chain. I would recommend the Varenne and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Special Place”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesEileen
Reviews.Content: I first found this hotel several years ago surfing the web, and booked a room for three nights. From the moment I entered the courtyard, I knew I had discovered something very special. Every aspect of my visit then, and every time I've visited since, has been infused with serenity. The staff is superbly professional and discrete, yet warm and friendly. Beatrix, Bita, Sultan, Valentine, and Mr. Pommier are people that I have come to know and look forward to seeing every year. The rooms are of varying sizes and kept immaculate. The neighborhood is quiet and centrally located to all the sites one comes to Paris to see. After a long day of visiting Paris, it is lovely to come back to Hotel de Varenne and rest in the courtyard or the salon. If you want to keep abreast of the world you left behind, there is an ample supply of daily newspapers, including the International Herald Examiner, or, of course, CNN or BBC World on the flat screen television in your room. Each time I have been to Hotel de Varenne I request, and receive, a room on the First Floor facing the courtyard. I love the large casement windows. When I first went to Paris I was told to stay in a chain hotel, which I did for the first couple of times because I didn't know any better. After having discovered Hotel de Varenne I can't conceive of staying elsewhere. It has become part of the entire Parsian experience for me. As long as Mr. Pommier is the proprietor, and as long as Beatrix is assisting him, I know I will not stay elsewhere. I would recommend to anyone going to Paris to stay at Hotel de Varenne. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Four years at the Hotel de Varenne!”
Reviews.Author: Vivianite
Reviews.Content: In January, it will have been four years since our first stay at our now- favorite Parisian hotel. We've stayed in every type of room (if not every room, in fact!) and have recommended Hotel de Varenne to many friends over those years. The verdict is unanimous: Hotel de Varenne is a jewel. It is intimate, pretty, friendly, well-appointed without being grand, clean, welcoming, tranquil, and, in spite of the dismally weak American dollar, affordable. We love the de Varenne's location in the 7th arrondissement, on and of the Left Bank, but just a few steps away from the Place de la Concorde, the Tuileries Gardens, and other treasures of the Right Bank. The staff are helpful and kind. Beatrice has become a friend I am always so happy to see when I return to our Parisian home away from home. Soultan is unfailingly polite and helpful. The staff has not changed since our first stay in January 2004, a fact that speaks very well of the hotel management. I stayed here, solo, in early September, in room 41, with its view of the Eiffel Tour (the top half, anyway!) and the hotel's bijoux courtyard. My husband and I are returning for several days in November. And then, it's on to our fifth year at the Hotel de Varenne. You could say we're fans.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect sanctuary in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TheSunKing
Reviews.Content: We just spent 8 fantastic days in Paris and stayed at the charming Hotel de Varenne because of the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The reviews were right on. The staff was great, including multilingual and helpful Beatrix and the night man we called Alfred (cuz he looked like Bruce Wayne's butler). The rooms (Superior) was spacious with a comfortable king size bed, easy WiFi access (12Euro for 24 hrs of on time) and large modern bathrooms with full size bath and shower. The hotel is located in the quiet 7th district. This is mostly government offices so after 5 it is nice and quiet. The Metro is a 5 min walk and Les Invalides is about the same distance. There is a fully stocked mini grocery store across the street and an upscale wine store a little further down. Pastry shops and cafes are nearby. We ended up ignoring the advice to avoid the breakfast and chose to eat in the hotel and get it out of the way. Although the continental breakfast, at 10 Euro, is a bit steep, for 6 euro you could get 2 eggs, coffee and the ever present baguette. Not a bad deal and no leaving the hotel required. The rooms were air conditioned so you can close the windows at night. The windows were all new, so street noise was minimal. And at the end of a long day of looking at wacky French art, make sure you plan to meet in the cozy Varenne courtyard with a bottle of St. Estaphe, a wheel of stinky fromage and yes, a baguette. (and throw a few crumbs to the resident pigeon, who we named Abindicator) All in all, a great, charming hotel at a decent price. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely ,Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunmin
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in perfect place for going to Effel tower ,Museum Orsay,Concord, Rodin Museum..etc... Reception was very kind and nice to us. It was first hotel for us to stay in Paris, You can find a small sized supermarket you can buy bottles of water and fruits and some snacks from Hotel.. but 10 Euro for breakfast is a little bit expensive. Streetfood (Panini) or Sandwitch is more cheaper and delicious..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Meem7
