Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Paris and we were celebrating our anniversary. We had spent hours looking through the hotels on-line and couldn't seem to find one that was close to the center of town, had nice amenities that wasn't going to cost us a fortune. We also were seeking good service as we do not speak french. Hotel de Varenne was perfect! We really enjoyed our room overlooking the garden/patio; it was very clean, nice bathroom, quiet, had a fridge and one morning we even smelled the baking of fresh pastries! We walked everywhere from the hotel and enjoyed a few very nice dinners that were close by as well. All of the staff we met there provided friendly service and were very helpful answering our questions and booking dinner reservations. They have a computer available for guests, umbrellas if it rains, breakfasts and can easily call taxis for you as well. We would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to veer away from the 5 stars...we would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sep1121
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently spent 6 nights at the Hotel de Varenne, and were very pleased with our pick of hotels. The hotel is on a rather quiet street in a quiet area of the city. This makes it very easy to unwind at night after a long day of exploring the city. The room we had was a standard double with a shower, and it was in very good shape. It was extremely clean and well kept. The bathroom was in excellent shape with a separate WC. The room itself would be considered small for people used to American hotels, but by European standards, it seemed like a standard size room. There was a flat screen TV with quite a few stations, and a DVD player in the TV. However, I don't know why somebody would choose a hotel in Paris based on the TV since it won't be watched much. The hotel is located within a five minute walk to the Invalides, which is where Napolean's tomb is, and about 2 minutes from the Musee de Rodin. There is also a metro station on the same block which made it extremely convenient and easy to get around the city. Most importantly, the staff was wonderful. The staff is who make the hotel what it is. Every staff member was extremely polite and made every effort to help us with whatever we needed. They also served an excellent continental breakfast which jump started our day of sightseeing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone without reservation and would more than likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil city hotel”
Reviews.Author: ratherbeathome
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 6 nights here with my wife and I in a superior double and our 2 boys (11 and 12) in a standard twin. The location has a LOT going for it if you're not used to city (or town for that matter) noise. We live in a rural location with no noise or street light at night, so finding somewhere that we can get a good night's sleep is very important to us and the Varenne certainly does that. The combination of a quiet area, a quiet street within that area and being tucked into a courtyard all help. Check was quick and simple (although I always understood that in customer service protocol it was a good idea to stand up to welcome someone?) and the lift small lift can just about take 2 people and a suitcase. Small but elegant reception area and the whole place has a cared-for feel about it. The hotel's own pics are a good representation of what you'll actually get. Our superior double (room 38) was larger than the boys' twin (25) although the sloping ceiling did mean that a good part of the floor area was either not really usable or could be walked under only with a severe stoop. I lost count of our combined total of head-bumping incidents! Good size and good quality double bed and linens. Very well appointed bathroom and separate WC in both rooms - all immaculately clean and look quite recently installed. Like most hotels they change towels only when you want for 'green' reasons, but sinks don't have plugs so you end up using a lot of extra water unnecessarily. Not quite sure how this fits in to a sustainability agenda? Large flat screen TV in each room - a huge Samsung multi-speaker set up in ours with DVD player too - a big hit with the kids, although it did rather dominate the room. Friendly staff and generous breakfasts served at a leisurely pace (until midday too!) either inside or in the courtyard, or in your room if you want. Location is ideal if you're happy to walk to get around or using the Metro. If you want to be able to stagger back from a heavy night this is not the hotel for you as apart form a small supermarket and shops and 3 or 4 restaurants, there's not much in the immediate area other than embassies and offices. I think the thing we missed most was the ability to get a coffee, tea or cold drink in the hotel other than at breakfast. Most UK rooms have tea and coffee making materials in the rooms and when a hotel doesn't have any bar or room service, and there's nothing in the immediate local area, this is a bit of a drawback. However that's minor niggle comared to everything else about this place and we'd certainly stay there again for a similar holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shame510
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here on our honeymoon and this was the first hotel we stayed in. The location was excellent, there is a metro stop just around the corner of the hotel and everything else is pretty much in walking distance. The size of the room and bathroom was much larger than the other hotels we stayed in. The staff are not much to write home about. They are helpful and polite but that's about it. They are not too friendly. The bed was dreamy--so comfortable. I also loved the courtyard, we opened our window every time we were in our room and it had a magnificent tree just outside. I would definately stay here again. You truely cannot beat the location. We did not have the breakfast, it was too expensive; instead we grabbed some croissaints from the boulangerie a couple doors down.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* htotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingEpicurean
Reviews.Content: As a 3* hotel it is hard to fault. It's convenient for many of the sites in Paris. The immediate area around the hotel is a bit quiet and dull. You have to walk at least 10-15 mins to get to a lively area with bars & restaurants. That aside it's one of the nicest 3*s I've stayed in in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlet318
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, within walking to Place de Concorde, Eiffel Tower, Orangerie, Musee D'Orsey and many other great places to visit. We felt safe here as it is close to the National Assembly. Although the room was small we were only there to sleep and there was a mini fridge in the room that kept our wine cold. A pretty courtyard was nice to sit in and have an afternoon glass of wine and baguette purchased at the local bakery. A wonderful bakery and grocery store are close by as are wonderful resturants. The rooms are clean, the breakfasts were excellent even though it was a continental. We would recommend this lovely hotel to any one wanting good service and a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil retreat”
Reviews.Author: KimP
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (including 10- and 13-year-old boys) stayed here for 4 days at the end of June. The hotel does not have connecting rooms, but we had two rooms next to one another at the back of the first (second) floor and felt as if we had our own little wing. As other reviewers have described, the rooms were spacious by European standards, nicely decorated, comfortable beds and linens, nice bathrooms. Couldn't have asked for more in that regard. Our rooms overlooked the lovely courtyard, which was very tranquil. A nice place to peruse your guidebooks while having a late afternoon wine and cheese break, as I observed one couple doing. We did notice that, because of the courtyard's enclosed nature, sound traveled quite easily up from the courtyard as well as from room to room. (For instance, with the windows open, we could hear our kids talking in their room next door.) However, during our stay, the hotel was very quiet (except for my family!) and we were never bothered by outside noise. Based on reviews here and elsewhere, we chose this hotel for our first stay in Paris because it was important to us to have a quiet place to return to at the end of a day out in the city. We got what we wished for--almost too much so! We arrived on a Saturday and the neighborhood was nearly deserted for the weekend. We had trouble finding open restaurants nearby on both Saturday and Sunday nights. Once Monday came around, it was like a different place, as the neighborhood is home to many government offices. There are grocers, patisseries, and fruit markets along the street, selling delicious (and expensive!) treats. The neighborhood is pleasant to walk around, but if you are looking for a lively neighborhood, with lots of street life, this is probably not the best location in which to base yourself. Once inside the hotel, all is quiet. I know that most people would find this very pleasant (and I'm not complaining!), but as a family travelling with two not-always-quiet boys, we sometimes found it a bit oppressive. Even at breakfast, guests seemed inclined to speak in hushed tones. So, just a warning that it might not be the best option for anyone travelling with young children. Recent reviews here have mentioned the helpful staff, but I'm sad to say that we did not find this to be the case. This is my one main complaint with the hotel and would be a serious consideration in whether I would ever stay here again. One of the reasons we decided to stay in a hotel during our first trip to Paris, rather than to rent an apartment, was because we wanted to be able to get information on local restaurants, the Metro system, shops, etc. Of the 4 or 5 desk staff we dealt with during our stay, only one could be considered friendly and somewhat helpful. When we were having trouble finding restaurants open on the weekend, and we specifically asked the man at the desk for suggestions, he just motioned with his hand that there were many restaurants "over that way." This may not be the best place to stay if you are in Paris for the first time and are hoping to get advice from the staff about things to see and do. In the lobby, I didn't notice any maps or literature around for tourists. Though there were many tourists, mostly American, at the hotel during our stay, I had the impression that the hotel sees itself more as catering towards those who are on business in the area. Lastly, the subject all reviews must deal with: the breakfast! We chose to have breakfast at the hotel each day; it was just easier for us. People complain about paying 10 Euros but, unless you really are only going to buy a cup of coffee and a croissant, in that neighborhood, you really aren't going to save any money. You will save time, however! The breakfast room is small and we had to wait about 10 minutes one day for a table to open up. Even when we were the only ones in the room, service was quite leisurely, so don't expect a quick bite and a gulp and go! There is a standard continental breakfast, but also a junior version (6 Euros), and many a la carte options, including eggs. No complaints with the food; it was very tasty and more than ample. And you can walk a few doors down for the most delicious fruit to accompany your breakfast! For the jetlag set, another plus is that breakfast is available until "midday", which we gratefully took advantage of the first morning of our arrival. This is a lovely hotel, as many reviews have noted. We wanted a quiet place, and that's what we got. My only complaint would be the less-than-friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great find! Very Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: EZimm44
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay for a first time in Paris! It is a beautifully renovated mansion. It is walking distance from the Arc de Triumph, Eiffel Tower, and the great shopping on the Champs Elysses. It has relatively spacious rooms with big windows, AC, flat screen TV, nice wood furniture, and a gorgeous bathroom, all new marble. Good price too. The only downside was that the a few of the staff members at the desk were not very helpful for first timers in Paris. My boyfriend and I managed to make it anyways. It is also right around the corner from 2 major metro stations, very convenient! This place was worth it and we will return. It made for a wonderfully romantic stay in an enchanting city!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalFamily4
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including two teenage daughters, just returned from a 8 night stay at the Varenne. The hotel is on a quiet street which is convenient to many sites and the metro. We booked two rooms (a double and a twin bed) facing the courtyard. The double was small, but perfectly adequate for our two daughters. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as we thought 10 Euros per person was a bit high, so we picked up pastries at one of the excellent bakeries on the street. We appreciated having a refrigerator in our room to store water, drinks, etc. which we purchased from the store across the street. The only downside to the hotel is the fact that it IS in a very quiet location with many government buildings. On our next trip, we would probably stay in an area like the Marais which is a bit livelier, and which has more restaurants and activities.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: mars000210
Reviews.Content: <<Hello, we just got back from our trip to Paris and thought I would post on the two hotels we stayed at while there. This hotel was located in the district where the embassies are located. ON a narrow street boarded by large embassy complex's and Rouden Museum just up the street the invalides park just two blocks away. Charming area, very quiet. A long narrow street, boarded by small shops and including two small mom and pop grocery stores. The room we booked was on the 2nd floor. It was large and the window opened on to a view of other ( we assumed homes) not a bad view at all. the room was largest of the two hotels in Paris we lodged at and the 2nd largest of the three hotels for our whole trip. The bathroom was large and had lovely tile and amenities the shower was thought not large was roomy enough with a shower curtain closure. Soaps and Shampoos were better quality then at the other hotels, large towels of nice quality and in the winter the towel rack must be designed to heat the towels up, nice touch. The whole bathroom was tiled, it was elegant looking. The room had besides nice furnishings, a thin, mounted TV, with cable with two channels for those that miss their CNN or BBC, English speaking TV. Adequate hair dryer in the bathroom. A safe, and a refrigerator as well. The closet lighted up the interior when it was opened and had shelf's and room to hang clothing. There was also a stand to place ones luggage on, rather then have ones bags on the floor. The bedding covers were nice, as were the linens for the bed and mattress and pillows were comfortable. all matched the decor nicely. When you enter the hotel it has a garden entrance with small table to sit at and read or eat a snack, or write home. The hotel had breakfast , the usual fair for Paris hotels, but we skipped that to eat at the local bakeries and restaurants. The other guests ate breakfast and the food appeared to look good. The first floor contained the lobby which was quaint and a breakfast eating area. The lift goes to the upper levels and well as there is a carpeted stairs to the upper floors.We had one hot day on our trip , and we were at this hotel and the air conditioner worked well. Individual units for each room. So you could adjust the air to ones choosing. It was quiet area, we enjoyed our stay there and would go again. \for those that are disabled it would be a good choice as there is space for either a wheel chair or electric wheel chair to be stored and no stairs to climb, and the larger rooms size and bathroom would be plus. The staff were nice and helpful, but not as friendly as the first hotel we used, I would say they were more gracious in manner when helping the guests. Not snooty, just more reserved in manner. Always a smile. It was some what a little more elegant place, compared to our other hotel. I was told they accommodate many visitors that have business at the embassies near by, that might account for the more reserved tone of the hotel, but don't get me wrong, the staff was still very nice. It is still a thumbs up choice. The walk to the Eiffel tower , about 2 miles in distance.The Museum D'Orsay was also close, about the same distance. There are several restaurants several blocks over with outside dining . In all we were glad we had two slightly different experiences with the hotels we chose, This hotel was a good choice to bring back some fond memories of Paris. I know many say you don't go to Paris to see the room, but to wake up and go to bed at night or take a break during the day for us it was nice to have a little ambiance of Paris in our commendations as well. I hope someone finds this helpful when making their choice when going to Paris. As I found the reviews here on tripadvisor a real plus when making our choices as to where to stay. Barbie>>

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Sweet Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: labjessie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect for my daughter and I. It was in a very very safe area(government district with police presence on just about every corner). The rooms had a safe and refrigerator plus tv with built in DVD. The rooms were air conditioned......and the bed very comfortable!! The front desk staff(not really a front desk as the lobby is very small) were great........helpful with directions, etc. It was within a 5 minute walk to the metro.....Varenne(Line 13) and just a stones throw from a great bakery....watched the baker make bread each morning. The hotel was about a 25 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and 10 minutes to the Rodin Museum. If I can answer any questions please contact me at dls5775@aol.com. I would not hesitate to stay here again!! Dana in VA

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: fishinal
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this gem of a hotel. Our double bed room was small but clean and well appointed.. the location was excellent... close to all major attractions and subway. the staff was extremely helpful... we would most definitely stay here again.. thank you trip advisor for this gem.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: beachgirlinmemphis
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at beginning of our France trip and one night at the end of the trip at Hotel de Varenne. Hotel was very centrally located for tourist locations - walked everywhere we went. Felt safe in the neighborhood even late at night. Although not a "luxury" hotel, the hotel met all our needs: friendly, helpful, English-speaking staff; very clean room with recently renovated bathroom; easy walking distance from attractions, and not overpriced. Ate breakfast at the hotel one morning (most of the area patisseries seem to be closed on Sunday morning) - standard French breakfast - pastries, bread, and jam - good quality and comparably priced to our other breakfasts. Overall I highly recommend the hotel - would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kasba
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for three nights for our three night stay in Paris. This was the end of a 17 day trip to France and Italy and we found this hotel to be the perfect end to a great trip. The staff were fluent in english and had a good knowledge of restaurants and directions getting around Paris. The hotel was clean, quiet and within walking distance of the major sights in Paris. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinebabe25
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel. It was very little, but quiet, nice, spotless. You even had a dvd player in the room, so bring your dvds with you. Room was a little bit tiny, but guess this is normal for Paris. Bath was new and with bath tube. There was no minibar in the room, you had to go to bed thirsty. People at the desk were helpful and friendly. Worst thing about the hotel is that you don't find any parking, and if you find one it will be more than expensive. But good area and walking distance to the tower. I payed about 120 â‚¬ for a night and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay, couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: midkad3456
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at Hotel de Varenne. The hotel is charming. Fantastic quality room. Outstanding service. Great location. Great place to stay. Looking forward to going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, comfortable and clean little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PHWPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: I spent days looking at hotel reviews on Trip Advisor and finally settled on Hotel de Varenne. The room was very nice, not too cramped, and very clean and well appointed. We had a regular twin and our friends had booked a superior twin--more space--but as nice as my room. The people at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. Location near the musee d'orsay was convenient--also not to far from the Louvre and the St. Germain area. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CAL_NORTH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. Nice and quiet and much more calm than the Latin quarter we usually stay in. It does take some transferring on the Metro and RER to get almost anywhere if that is your means of transit. This could be a problem if you are coming from the airport with bags as many stations only have stairs. The staff is friendly and helpful although do not expect a concierge who can make suggestions and book dining and site seeing. They do speak English and will call for you if you do the research first. There are many restaurants and cafes in the area so we never opted for breakfast in the hotel. It is also located walking distance from Rue du Bac where there is an excellent up-scale modern food store. Also there is Ryst Dupeyron, the best Armagnac shop in Paris where you can taste many old vintages and ports. The rooms do have small refrigerators which was nice especially for keeping that cheese and water cold. There is a small courtyard with chairs and tables at the hotel entry which we used to have our wine and cheese. Be prepared that each room has a heating/cooling unit mounted high on the wall in a corner. They mounted the controls under the unit so you have to get on a chair to make adjustments - which is problematic especially in the dark if you want to change the settings. There are also no instructions as to how to use the controls so you may want to ask. All in all I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly average...some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: LtColG
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews and the consistent high rankings this hotel has received, we decided to forgoe our normal Parisian hotels and try this one. I can say, that having expereinced other Parisian hotels, this would not be my first, or last, choice. It pretty much ranks in the middle for location and price. It ranks somewhat above for the room amenities and decor, but below for the service and breakfast. We stayed for three nights mid-April and Paris in the spring is everything you hear about. Flowers, warm pleasant weather, romance...viva la France. The location of the hotel is in a residential/business district so it is very quiet at night. There are restaurants around, but not a huge selection and don't expect much night-life in the area. It's about a 7-10 minute walk to a Metro station and the Eifel tower is about 20-30 minutes away We checked in and the lobby is essentially non-existant. A small room at the foot of the stairs with a desk and computer where the receptionist sits. When we checked in an Indian gentleman was the receptionist and wasn't particualry friendly or helpful. His English was very good however. He confirmed our rooom and handed us the key. Very matter-of-fact. Later I asked for information on restaurants and he gave a generic answer about several in the area, but no specifics on recommendations and/or locations. So we just wandered until we found one. Next to the "lobby" is a small room where newspapers are available and a small breakfast nook. There is no bar. Our room was standard for Paris...small. However, the hotel and the room were very well decorated. A wonderful Parisian charm.. . Definite plus for the hotel here. The room had a spacious bathroom with stand-up shower, haridryer as well as plenty of counter space. The room istself had a flat screen TV, small desk, mini-bar, closet and safe . The view was of the courtyard leading from the street... nothing spectacular. Room noise was minimal and we only had one disturbance during our stay from noise in the hall. Our biggest disappointment was the breakfast. We chose to eat breakfast at the hotel twice, but after those two expereinces just decided to hit the bakery and grocery store just 10 meters down the street. Breakfast cost 10 Euro per person and consisted of some rolls/baquettes, cofee or tea, jam... and that's about it. I've eaten "continental" breakfasts in dozens of European hotels, to include some in Paris, and this ranks near the bottom for selection and service. The breakfast service was provided in a small little nook/room next to the receptionist desk and consisted of four cramped tables. Come at the wrong time and you have to stand and wait. The waitress spoke no English and was overworked since the tables were always full. We waited usually 10 min before we got any attention. Take my advice, save the money and go buy your breakfast at the bakery next door and the supermarket across the street. One small little note. The TV in the room upon our arrival was a very trendy 20" flat screen. The hotel literature said the hotel has DVDs for viewing so one night we decided to check out the selction. The hotel had about 40 DVDs, consisting of 1-2+ yr old films (Ocean 12, Lord of the Rings, etc...). However, when I took the DVD up to the room, there was no way to watch it. There was no DVD player?! Later the next day we came back to the room to find a new, bigger flat-screen TV..... with a built in DVD player...alright!! However, when I turned it on to catch some english language news (BBC, Sky, CNN), the only offerings were in French. I have no idea why our bigger, DVD TV lost its english language channels. Hopefully the hotel resolved this later after our departure. So, overall a pleasant experience. But knowing what I know now, this will be our last visit as there are more and better offereings in Paris for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lakecherokee5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my teenage daughter. Had a wonderful experience. Room was small, typically parisian, but very clean and new. Lovely bathroom. We overlooked the courtyard, room #35. Desk staff were proficient in English even though we both spoke French. Continental breakfast for Euros 10. Lovely lady served us each morning. Great location, just a few minutes from a Metro stop, or convenient if you don't mind walking. We didn't need heat or A/C during our visit, but both were available. Had a small problem with their credit card machine at checkout, but once it rebooted all was well. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased With This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in an excellent location. We had the least expensive room, at 127 euros per night, and it was very small. It was comfortable and spotless, however, and the bathroom was relatively spacious. The staff was exceptionally polite and helpful. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy little hotel in busy Paris”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: Usually I always go to the same hotel in Paris, but decided after reading the review from fellow TAs to try this one out. It's actually a nice and cosy hotel, in a cool neighborhood (Invalides). It's very clean, the rooms are very nice but small (OK. who spends time in his room when in Paris ?) For a 3 star hotel, the price/quality ration is very good (hidden gem ? Maybe). Why not a rating of 5 then ? Mainly because the breakfast isn't that special (this is a standard breakfast in Paris, you can also get it in any bistro or cafÃ©), and also because I hate being waken up early by workers on the floor above...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for average Paris tourist”
Reviews.Author: FLEABUS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in Aug 2005. This place is 3 star and perfect for what the average tourist needs who wants to retire at the end of the day to peace and quiet. It is situated in the Government district of the city which is not only quiet at night but also full of fine buildings. Eiffel Tower is only a short walk away too. Literally a few minutes walk around the block is a Metro station as well. Rooms are great with all the necessaries - TV, safe, clean bathroom, reasonable space. We stayed on top floor at the back (no view at the front anyway and probably noisier there as well). The breakfast was by far the best we tasted in the whole 2 weeks we stayed in France, which also included three B&Bs. Had a sneak view of a bigger room and it seemed ok for families. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “paris please and thank you”
Reviews.Author: francisparis
Reviews.Content: a lovely charming place. the service was fine and they had just hired a gentleman who made sure we had coffee the morning we had to leave (so very early)!!!- the others who worked there knew of the locations of restaurants and they also set us up with the perfect new Years Eve dinner! the rooms are typically parisienne in their size--so make sure you ask for the size you prefer! we had no complaints. And we had previously been to two boutique hotels-- Neither of those had internet access and one had poor lighting! we would recommend it again, and we are picky!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: SueGrogan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 29th Dec to 1st January. The hotel is small and the staff are very friendly. The room we stayed in was larger than we expected and was extremely clean and comfortable. As other people have stated, the hotel is in a quiet location but is in easy walking distance to other livelier areas of the city. It is also a short walk to the nearest metro station. Considering what some of the other hotels were charging in Paris, I would consider this hotel to be excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AnNorth
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in Hotel de Varenne just before Christmas 2006. We wanted a hotel in a quiet and safe area, within walking distance of the city centre (St German des Pres etc.), and not too expensive. Hotel de Varenne proved to be just that. We booked the winter special offer (129 euro per room, breakfast included) and for that price, we got an authentic, nicely furnitured and comfortable place to stay; a quiet haven from the moment you walk into the entrance garden. Initially, we had a room on the fourth floor based on our miscommunication, but the staff was more than helpful to transfer us to the second floor; less stair-climbing and somewhat spacier. Considering the price, the room was good: nice furniture, excellent badroom and well ventilated. Not much view since we booked a room on the courtyard, but we had absolutely no traffic noise at night. Only the polyester blankets we considered out of date and not too clean, but this was not a great problem. Breakfast is (like in almost every hotel of this pricerange) typically French: tea, coffee or chocolate, orange juice and a basket of bread. If you don't expect an English hotel breakfast buffet, then it's all very fine. The hotel lies in the eastern part of the 7th Arrondissement, a very safe and well-heeled neigbourhood, with some nice restaurants quite nearby. We particularly recommend Le Ferme de Saint Simon (in the Rue de St Simon), a lovely restaurant with very kind staff, however somewhat expensive. Even late at night, this area is very safe, also for two women alone. You can walk to St Germain des Pres (twenty minutes) or to the city centre via the Tuileries (half an hour). There are also two metro stations nearby. If you want a quiet place to stay in a authentic, charming hotel on a moderate budget, Hotel de Varenne is just the right place to you.

Reviews.Title: “A really wonderful place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: regnigc
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop for my mother and I on our European adventure and we were pleasantly surprised by Hotel de Varenne. It is well appointed with all of the amenities that we needed. We had a lovely view of the pretty courtyard below, which was a real treat. The hotel was within walking distance to the main attractions and close to the Metro. There were some nice little restaurants right outside the door....and the breakfast was not so bad. If you order the breakfast for two, you get a lot of coffee, warm milk and loads of pastries to get you going for the day. The best part of this hotel was the courteous and very gracious staff. They were very knowledgable and gave us very good tips and directions. I would recommend this hotel for almost anyone....:)

Reviews.Title: “Paris perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dancermissa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the Varenne for 4 nights in Sept 06.We had a wonderful stay.The hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood with plenty of daytime activity because parisiens actually live there.The hotel was a sanctuary after a hectic days activities.Open top bus(fantastic and our main means of transport) stop close by as is the beautiful Rodin Museum.Lovely little shops close by and everyone so friendly (which is a first for me in the 12 or so times I have been there).I think this is because it is not a tourist area.The staff are fairly cool but I think this is the french way of not intruding ,so I had no problem with it.Every request was politely met.The room was quaint ,clean,fridge a bonus, big bathroom with bath!!!!!!! and lovely big windows opening onto greenery .We slept with the windows open every night.We loved it and finally after all these years"I love Paris" too!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your Euro”
Reviews.Author: themoos
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Varenne 10 years ago, and were so pleased to find it even better than before. The decor is pleasant, the rooms are smallish but comfortable and clean as a whistle, baths up to date, but most of all the location is perfect. Centrally located at the edge of the 7th arr., easy walking distance to the Musee d'Orsay, the Rodin Museum, the Invalides, Grand Palais etc. etc. Close to a metro station. Most of all, the concierge/receptionist, Beatrix, is a gem. Multi lingual, very helpful, went out of her way to anticipate our needs, helped us find locations with a map of the city, lent us guidebooks, suggested restaurants and booked for us - all with a smile. We believe that the Varenne must be one of the best values for the money in Paris, an expensive city. We have recommended it to friends, and certainly would stay there again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KMiles
Reviews.Content: This is a very lovely hotel, situated in a really nice, safe and quite area of Paris. It's very comfortable and clean with excellent breakfasts. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: qwedfr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a couple of nights at Hotel de Varenne beginning of october and were very pleased. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Our room was very elegant. A little small but this is probably french standard. We loved the ambience, the garden and the location in the peaceful 7th arrondisement. The staff of this hotel deserves every compliment. We shall never look for another hotel in Paris! This is the place to be when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: nfsns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Varenne beginning of october for 3 nights. We did a lot of research on Paris hotels prior to our trip and found that the Varenne is an excellent value compared to other hotels in Paris. Perfect location, away from the crowds, in a residential neighborhood, but close to St. Germain, the Orsay, Louvre and Rodin. The standard of the room was excellent, relaxing, very clean and the bed extremelly comfortable. The service was very good. Friendly helpful staff, assisted us on numerous occasions with reservations and other matters. We warmly recommend this place to anybody. The value is probably one of the best you can find in Paris, you really feel at home at Le Varenne. I would certainly want to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel de varenne review”
Reviews.Author: pzxkys
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews we stayed in this Hotel from September 23 through September 29. We were very pleased with the location and the choice! Thanks to Trip Advisor for helping us come up with a winner. What a great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just loved paris”
Reviews.Author: thymat
Reviews.Content: My family and I just completed a trip to Paris from Canada and stayed at the small hotel de Varenne at 44 Rue de Bourgogne in Paris. We booked on the net. Small in size, it makes up for that with the excellent service and pleasant accomodation and breakfast in the garden setting. While staying at the Varenne we took day trips with 'Paris trips' and were royally treated by the guides "Florence" and "Norma" . These two lovely ladies made our trip to Paris unforgettable and they are a credit to their employer. Just absolutely tops. Thanks again. Matt Thys, Lethbridge, Alberta ,Canada

Reviews.Title: “Believe the good things about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedPuffin
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Paris. The courtyard rooms are wonderfully quiet, and a good size. The airconditioning was very good. It was 35 outside, but we were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and classy”
Reviews.Author: jclayton9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was GREAT! We stayed four nights in the â€œdouble with bathâ€�. It was a little small, but typical for Paris. The Good: a) Fridge in Room: There is a little store across the street where you can get all sorts of things, and the fridge was great for keeping them in. You can get 9E Chatauneuf De Papes!!! b) Internet is cheap (1 hour for 4E). You get a little card that you log in with and it keeps track of your time throughout your stay. c) Location. Extremely safe, and much closer to attractions than I had thought. Walk down the street, turn left, and there is a great view of the Eiffel tower. Invalides is RIGHT THERE! Amazing restaurants in walking distance. d) Breakfast is perfectâ€¦especially when itâ€™s free! The waiting staff is really nice too. e) The box of DVDs is great for bed time if you are like me and need something on to fall asleep. The only channel that you can get in English is CNNâ€¦and nothingâ€™s a bigger downer on vacation than CNN. The Bad: a) REALY quiet (Area and Hotel). Itâ€™s the kind of place where you feel like you have to whisper in the tiny lobby. This could be a plus for some people. The street is DEAD past 10:00pm. The Ugly: a) The receptionist lady that works during the day was the only person in all of Paris that was cold to us. She warmed up quite a bit by check out. We think that it might have been because of the fact that my wife and I traveled with large back packs, and she probably looked at us like student back-packers, which I imagine is not their intended customer base. Everyone else was very kind to us.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: travelingnan
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Varenne. This was the perfect choice for a mother with teenage son. On a quiet street around the corner from the Rodin museum and the Place de Invalides - the location was perfect. We were within easy walking distance of the Eiffel tower and the Rue Clair district. All of the front desk staff were friendly and helpful and most spoke excellent English. Breakfast was nice and could be taken in room, or in the breakfast room or in the cute shaded patio area. Internet access was available for a reasonable fee. Our standard room was cozy but fine for 2, and the bathroom was spotless and modern. The furnishings were very nice and appeared fairly new. The beds were quite comfortable. Our room overlooked the little courtyard - no view, but also no street noise. Some of the rooms were quite a bit larger, so if you need more space book the deluxe. An excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, a few glitches...”
Reviews.Author: generaltravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel de Varenne for 8 nights. It was quiet and quaint. The courtyard is lovely and we enjoyed our breakfast there in the morning. The room was more spacious than anticipated, but cleanliness was not top grade. There was so much dust on the dark red lamp cover, I drew happy faces on it to get the cleaner's attention. The happy faces remained untouched for our entire stay. The DVD player came with the room, great free selection of movies too! but the DVD player turned out to be broken and didn't get fixed when brought to the attention of hotel staff. FInally, our flight got bumped to 8:30 am (instead of noon) and we let the manager know we would have to take a hotel room at the airport on the last night because we had to be there early and we were 1 hour away by metro. He told us that we had reserved the room and we would have to pay for it. We emphasized to him that we didn't want to leave, our flight time was changed, we had been there for 7 nights and it was 9:00 am - way before the checkout time, and we wouldn't be there for the breakfast which was included in our price. He suggested we take a taxi (about 100 E) instead of the metro (14 E for 2 people) and again stated he would charge us for the room that night regardless. We thought this was inconsiderate and insensitive. In the end, we called the airline, paid for advanced flight booking and woke up at 5:00 am to get to the airport by metro at 5:30. Overall though, we do recommend this hotel to others. It is charming and ideally located for sightseeing; just make sure you don't have a change in plans!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, quiet, perfect”
Reviews.Author: dmmbmom
Reviews.Content: If you don't need or want the expense of fancy lobbies, huge chandeliers, etc., then this is perfect. I stayed there with my four kids (ages 10 - 17) for a week. It's a small hotel; the lobby is about the size of a bedroom and the dining room is even smaller. But it's right around the corner from the terrific Musee Rodin (sculptor of "The Thinker", "The Kiss", etc.), and within walking distance of Les Invalides, the Eiffel Tower, and the Rue Cler. My kids and I also walked from the hotel to places like St. Germain des Pres, St Michel (Notre Dame area), Place de la Concorde, Champs-Elysees...pretty much all the main tourist attractions are within a half-hour of walking, which is not much by Parisian standards. Comfort-wise the main things are that it has good air-conditioning in the bedrooms, the bathrooms are clean and updated and have great smooth Corian sinks (I wanted to take one home!). Like most European hotel rooms, the ones at the Hotel de Varenne are small by American standards, but the 5 of us were perfectly comfortable in two rooms. The staff is helpful and pleasant. A woman named Beatrix was particularly nice to me and my kids and gave us suggestions on where to go. The morning breakfast is included in the room rate and is the typical delicious hotel continental breakfast fare. I got very used to hot chocolate and croissants being served to me on pretty yellow and blue-flowered china. I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, Comfortable & Friendly Boutique Hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Maribri
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at Hotel de Varenne and we loved it. We booked a basic double room with shower and it was more than adequate. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom excellent. The staff are helpful and speak excellent English and breakfast is very good. The weather was beautiful and the staff were happy to arrange glasses and ice for us to have a drink in the garden. They lent us a corkscrew and generally co-operated with all our requests. Our Paris stay was at the end of a long holiday and after splashing out on dinner at the Moulin Rouge (absolutely fantastic and worth every cent) we were on a budget. The restaurants right by the hotel looked excellent but were quite expensive when converted to Australian dollars. However, a supermarket is across the road and we had delightful picnic dinners which suited us better. We have already recommended this hotel to friends visiting Paris and we will stay there again. It is very close to a Metro and we were able to access everything easily. A good, solid choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Giulius
Reviews.Content: Family stayed one week while sightseeing. Quiet, safe area. Very convenient location - Metro around the block, market across the street, pharmacy, bistros within short walk. Spotless rooms, air conditioning, refrigerator, beautiful baths, nice Continental breakfast (try to get it included). Very helpful staff. What's not to like? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our whole experience”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and it exceeded all our expectations. We got quite a good deal and I really didn't think it was going to be a great hotel but we were pleasantly surprised. The courtyard was an Oasis in a Parisian Heatwave, where we relaxed in the shade. The staff may not have been on the reserved side, but they were there when we needed them. We had to get an English speaking Doctor to come to the hotel, which they arranged and he turned up within half an hour. Our first room was small but immaculate with a lovely veiw over the courtyard. The second room, which we were given when we extended our stay, was huge and had a view over the street and the courtyard. The hotel was cosy clean and very professional. I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: pantha05
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I travelled to Paris just a few weeks ago and loved it very much. Hotel de Varenne was just wonderful. It is situated in a very safe and upper-class neighborhood. The hotel is very close to the Eiffel Tower. The Metro is only a few minutes away as well. We actually expected the room to be much smaller, but since we were given the 147 Euro room even though we had booked the room for 127 Euros, this might be the reason for the slightly larger size of the room. The hotel has a nice courtyard where breakfast is served. We enjoyed a nice evening there as well. I can only recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a residential neighborhood. Very comfortable, pretty, clean rooms, yet small. It is Paris afterall. Helpful service. Make sure you have some pastries from the bakery down the block! We bought pastries every morning and took them back to the hotel patio, where we would order juice and coffee. It was very pleasant. If you don't mind having to walk a few blocks to get close to more busy areas, this is a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: melissa70
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for five nights. This small hotel is beautiful. We booked a superior twin with airconditioning and had a view of the street which was nice to open the balcony windows to. The only problem is the staff, the gentelman that works Monday thru Friday from 1-9 was so rude the whole trip. He was totally unfriendly and acted very bothered when we asked him for help. He was either talking on the phone and watching tv and did not to get up. He was very short and rude to me several times. Becasue of this I would not reccommend this hotel. Unhappy in Texas

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Hotel de Varenne”
Reviews.Author: JRM22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 10 day vacation in Paris. We stayed at the Hotel de Varenne in the 7er. We absolutely fell in love with the neighborhood and this "little jewel" of a hotel. Just as you have read in the othe reviews and forums here, Rue De Bourgogne has everything you need for your stay. A Patisserie next door -- delicious Quiche! -- an ATM, pharmacy, grocery stores, wine shop, book store and a couple of small restaurants are on this street. Assemblee Nationale is located at one end of the street and the Musee Rodin is at the other (across the street) so the area is very safe. There are two Metro stations nearby. We arrived at the hotel around 10:00 am and were delighted to find our room was ready for us. The room was small but very nicely decorated in provencial colors, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large with a tub and shower, a nice vanity and a separate water closet. We had very little noise because our room overlooked the courtyard. We stayed in Room 25. Beatrix and Soultan, hotel staff, were very courteous and helpful. Our luggage did not arrive with us (good ole United Airlines) and Beatrix and Soultan went out of their way to assist us in locating it. Beatrix also made arrangements for our side trip to Brugge, Belgium and she and Soultan arranged for taxis a couple of times. We made our request the night before and yes, they were there on time! We enjoyed the lovely courtyard area. It was a relaxing place to have a glass of wine after a long day of sightseeing. A couple of nights we just picked up something to eat and had dinner in the courtyard. Afterwards, we walked a couple of blocks to get a view of the Eiffel Tower light show. We are looking forward to our next trip to Paris and will definitely stay on the left bank at the Hotel de Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyssia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel de Varenne for 5 nights while we were in Paris. We picked this hotel based on the review here. We were in room 43 which looked over the front of the building. The room was the typical small room and very clean. We thought the hotel was in a very good location, and close to the metro; which made getting around very easy. The staff was friendly, and helped us when we had questions. We did feel that breakfast was not worth the cost here. For 10 euro, you would get a small basket of assorted breads, coffee and Juice. If you're looking to save a little cash, 2 doors down from the hotel, there is a great bakery and across the street from that is a nice grocery store. Since the room offered mini- refreg, we bought water, cheese, lunch meat and stuff for our bread that we got at the bakery and had that for breakfast. If we were to go to Paris again, I would probably consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: TripAdvMember12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel, selected primarily on the basis of the reviews posted here and price (naturally). I felt it was a decent spot but not as good as the reviews have made it out to be. Our room was not available at 12:15 PM so we had to leave our bags and have lunch at a creperie down rue de Bourgogne (which was lovely, by the way). We came back an hour later and were given our key. The room was quite small (which we weren't surprised about) but relatively clean. Not that well lit, and the bathroom was very strange as it had built-in shelves that seemed very gratuitous. There was a flat screen TV and DVD player which was a nice touch, as well as a mini-fridge. Our bed was a not very comfortable double. As other reviewers have noted, the staff is not particularly helpful as far as restaurants although they did give my husband a little map of the area with marked places on it. They also helped him find a place to get some takeout soup for me as I was ill. Also they did not replace our soap or even the plastic cups used for water after I threw them away one night, which I think is a pretty basic thing to expect. The other frustrating thing about the location is that although you are nearly close enough to the Hotel des Invalides metro stop, the closest one is actually the Varennes stop, which is not on a major line. We did a lot of transferring to get to this line, although to be fair, you really could just walk most of the time. We walked from the hotel to St. Germain de Pres and the Eiffel Tower, although they might be far for some people. To summarize I would say it was a decent stay although I wouldn't be likely to seek it out again - will probably try another similarly priced, better located three star and see how we make out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: brooklynwanderers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days/nights at this hotel in mid-May 2006. We read all the reviews before choosing the hotel, and found most all the reviews were very accurate, though I have a different take on some aspects of the hotel and neighborhood. The value is very good for such a clean hotel with new bathrooms, in a nice neighborhood. But our room (the cheapest rate room offered, with a shower not a tub) was TINY and we felt b/c we were staying and paying for 9 nights they could have given us a larger room for the money. It's difficult not even having a chest of drawers and having to literally live out of the suitcase for 9 days. I love the 7th arrondissment. It's so close to many sites, and it's clean and picturesque. Musee Rodin is a couple blocks away which all our friends urged us to see and which was wonderful having nearby b/c we got to see it twice, once in the day and once late at night after dinner. The real difference between the pricier hotels and this one is the staff, ultimately. Only very self-sufficient and people who already know Paris should stay here because the staff know almost nothing about restaurants to recommend, how and where to get a cab for dinner (though they will phone for an airport shuttle for you) or what stores sell what nearby. They are all friendly people, but do not provide true, proper "concierge" service. We actually had to walk to another more expensive hotel our first night, to get a recommendation from that concierge for dinner who more readily helped us even though we weren't guests there. Also note the nearby restaurants (many good ones, btw) close early and keep odd hours on odd days, so if you need to eat dinner late plan to eat in another neighborhood or to buy sandwiches you can carry back to the hotel. Otherwise you'll be left digging for stray lefotver airline peanuts in your purse like I was one night! But don't be scared off by my comments, it's a great hotel and a great value. Just keep these tips in mind, and splurge for the room with bath which is significantly larger than the room with shower. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Planestrainsnautos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Paris where we spent 8 nights in Room 26, a standard double which looked out over the courtyard. Rate 146E. I researched the Parisian hotels extensively prior to booking. Try to find a 3 star hotel at this rate in a fairly central location where the rooms and bathrooms are relatively large, well decorated and clean, and come with a small refrigerator (great for storing wine and picnic items), an in room safe, a flat screen TV with 3 english speaking channels, and a shower curtain. There was no alarm clock but you can "program" the phone to give you a wake up call. I'd bring an alarm clock for back up though. The room was very quiet with respect to outside noise. But the walls are apparently pretty thin. The phone in the adjacent room was easily heard in ours. That said, we rarely heard any voices. I think everyone must have spoken in quiet tones. The prior reviewers were dead on with respect to the location of the hotel. For those wanting to walk out of the hotel into a street of "action", stay elsewhere. Such a street is a good 15 minute walk or so. Nevertheless, there are plenty of restaurants, a grocery store and everything else you'll need very close by. ATM is just down the street. The nearest metro is an easy 5 minute walk. Most of the top attactions are within a 15-30 minute walk. The staff was for the most part reserved but very helpful. This is not a B&B type place where they fall over themselves to help you but I believe that's the norm for Paris. There are about 6 people who staff the front desk 24/7. Not all had restaurant recommendations. They give you a xerox copy of a map showing some French restaurants in the 7th but they don't seem prepared to make other recommendations, which is probably not unusual. So come prepared with your own list of places to eat. They will gladly make reservations, call cabs and do all that stuff. For you Mastercard holders, you might check with the hotel to confirm that they take it. We tried to pay for our stay with one and it was not accepted. The receptionist didn't know why but said it was a problem on her end which was clearly the case since I'd been using that card all week, had notified my MC company we'd be in Paris, had gobs of money left on the credit limit, and were able to use it immediately when we got home. So I'm not sure what the problem was. Fortunately we had a Visa card which did go through. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: hw409
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here last week, and miss it already heh. Really nice hotel - while it isn't cheap per se (many of the rooms approach or exceed $200), you get what you pay for and I think it was a good value for the quality. Impeccable rooms in nice matching Empire furnishings along with flat screen TV, DVD player, and free movies. The staff was reserved but helpful; a good match for the generally well-heeled clientele. Location is good. A nice number of cafes, patisseries, and small groceries right on the street, but of course it isn't the Latin Quarter either. Lots of small fancy businesses, embassies, etc. so basically lots of people in suits during the day. These stores all close at night too, but the area is very safe at night and you're just a 10 minute walk to the Rue Cler area. About 5-10 min walk to the Metro. The nearest Metro stop (Varenne) is not on a main line, so some switching will be necessary if you're planning on taking it to most other areas. The location is perfect is you're planning on concentrating in the Champs-Elysees, Invalides, Eiffel Tower, Rue Cler area, or if you've seen most of the high-volume tourist areas near the Notre Dame already. Basically the hotel was so nice it made us want to stay in it longer during the day, which for jet-lagged travelers could be a dangerous thing! (By contrast, our first (and much cheaper) hotel in the 6eme was so small you always felt compelled to leave) Highly recommended, for those who aren't set in staying in the more high-traffic areas.

Reviews.Title: “Accurate reviews”
Reviews.Author: patio53
Reviews.Content: First of all, thanks to all who write reviews for this website. We found the reviews to be very accurate. This hotel definitely deserves its rank. My only trepidation in writing this review is that someday it will be too popular to get a reservation! After comparing its location with my other top choices, I'm glad we choose it. The laws of physics dictate that if it's a busy street and you're above it, noise travels up! at first glance the street did look very quiet, but as we got to know the area we found all we needed. Others have mentioned the various shops for food, etc..so I'll just mention the ATM at the end of the block (left out of the hotel) where you feel very safe. We ate at Le Basilac, one of the restaurants on the sheet that the front desk will give you for asking. It's very close and business was just picking up when we left at 9p.m. We loved the hotel! The staff is gracious, polite and willing to help. The rooms are clean and tastefully decorated and the bathrooms were great. My husband is a pretty good-sized guy and he felt very comfortable with the beds and the bath. The mini-fridge came in handy and we stocked up from the store across the street (and the patiserrie down the street) We ordered a taxi for the airport the day before with the front desk and it arrived right on time.The gentleman that placed the order was kind enough to ask about our luggage and realize we would need to reserve a larger taxi.Oh,just remember that if you order a taxi, the meter starts from their departure point, not your's! We're definitely going to stay here again.t

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: brownbeer
Reviews.Content: Spotless, in a great location. Spacious room, even by American standards (#42, top floor), looked out on to the street. With the windows closed, it was silent. With them open, from 10pm to 6am there were very few cars or trucks. Room #45 was smaller and opened out onto the courtyard, which was quieter. Multiple embassies in the area make it very safe. Police (with automatic weapons)presence is obvious. Hotel claims wi-fi in rooms but couldn't get a decent signal on 4th floor. No problem in the lobby but you do need to pay for it. 15 minute walk to Eiffel Tower and 10 minutes to Musee Dâ€™Orsay. Two metro stations, Varenne and Solferino, make it very convenient for the rest of the sites of Paris. There is a great patisserie right next door. Artisan bread shop as well. Only possible objection was a frosty receptionist. In fairness to her, within the first five minutes of checking in, my sons broke the (tiny) elevator and locked their key in the room, so maybe the attitude was justified. This hotel is really a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel-Totally DEAD location”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for anyone who wants nothing more than peace, quiet and luxury from a hotel in Paris. But, if you want a lively neighborhood, a feel for real Paris charm and life - you wonâ€™t want to stay here and for this one reason, I personally would never stay at this hotel again. I just wish I could move it to a more interesting neighborhood. The location is perfect for those who prefer a very quiet in a rather ritzy neighborhood in Paris. This hotel is in the area of governmental buildings and embassies, on a street which has one or two restaurants, and a few businesses, mostly high-end specialty shops and very few places of interest in general â€“ and it was dead, day or night. The neighborhood seems very reserved and uppity. The plus side is that it makes it super safe, but at night, its like a nuclear bomb has hit after 9 pm. Nothing is open and everything is deadly quiet- you are lucky if you see another human in the vicinity of the hotel after 10 pm. God forbid you need a meal after 9 pm in this area.... This may have been due to the season (Late March-early April) but somehow I got the feeling this was typical of the street all year round. As I much prefer a lively neighborhood with businesses that stay open late, Iâ€™d choose to stay in another area, such as Rue Daguerre in Montparnasse â€“you get a truly feel for Paris â€“ the local groceries stay open till 3 am and people sit around chatting and drinking in cafes until well after midnightâ€¦.its a nice break from the over-lively and touristy St. Germain areas and has a number of nice hotels. If I could move Varenne to such an area, it would be perfection in Paris. If you are the type who likes to retreat to a super quiet residential area at night, look no further. There is nothing more you can ask for in a hotel in Paris in this price range and there is a reason why this is #1 on tripadvisor in its price group. The hotel is super clean, with the best quality material used for every part of it â€“ from the windows, which are new and double glass for quiet, to the plasma TVs, DVD players, luxury bathroom with great shower and water pressure â€“ you wonâ€™t find better quality at some 4* places in Paris. Everything is super clean. Skip the breakfast and go to another neighborhood for breakfast (because you wonâ€™t get any options here other than the Patisserie next door, which is pricey) â€¦but other than that, everything about the actual hotel is fantastic. All you have to do is be the type who likes it totally dead in the neighborhood you stay, and thinks of the hotel as a place of rest and nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VinM
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights last week and thoroughly enjoyed it. We had a room in the eaves (but there is a lift all the way) It was a good size and the bathroom and separate WC were generous. A very large plasma TV and DVD player (with free DVDs from reception) were other noteworthy aspects of the facilities. The guy at reception gave us three excellent and quite different restaurants for dinner each night and also made the bookings. The one criticism was that there were not enough staff on for breakfast and on two days we had to wait for tables to be cleared of the debris from earlier diners. The breakfast itself was at the good end of the typical continental breakfast spectrum.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havlat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de Varenne mid-March for 7 nights. We did a lot of research on Paris hotels prior to our trip and found that the Varenne is an excellent value compared to other hotels in Paris. The hotel is on a quiet street, but very centrally located to many sites in the city. My one complaint with the location is the lack of restaurants in the immediate area, after a long day of walking around the city it would have been nice to have some options close to the hotel. There is an excellent bakery next door, a grocery across the street, and two bank machines at the rue de Grenelle and Bourgogne. The area is very safe and we felt very comfortable walking around late at night. The hotel: the lobby is very small, with a small dining area to the right as you enter. We never ate breakfast at the hotel, but was usually busy when we were leaving in the morning. A very small elevator was tucked away at the other side. The lobby was very small but quaint. We stayed in two different rooms during the week. The first was priced at 120 euros and was located on the second floor. It was located at the end of the hallway, which I thought would be great for noise, but the walls were extremely thin. We heard every noise made in the room next to us, below us and above us, usually sound doesn't bother me, but it was pretty bad...some nights we had a hard time sleeping because of the thin walls. The room was clean and small. One day they installed shelves in our bathroom, without our notification, after which the room smelt of varnish for the remainder of the stay. The second room we stayed in was much better, it was 140 euro on the same floor, but was much bigger, and had two large windows overlooking the garden, we wish we had stayed in this room all week. If you like extra features in your hotel: gyms, spas etc than this isn't the hotel for you. If you are self-sufficient and don't require a lot of attention, than this hotel could be for you. It is good value for the money in a very very expensive city. Based on recommendations on this site, we took a taxi to the hotel upon arrival at CDG, it cost approx. 45 euros on a quiet Sunday morning with two suitcases. We took the RER on the return trip to the airport and was glad we didn't attempt it on our arrival, but is a good option when you get familiar with the metro system. It cost 16 euros and took approx. 1 hour. Thanks again to trip advisor for helping us select another great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gottman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days in March. Room was a good size. Having a fridge in the room was great for keeping drinks. Internet connectivity is great - but the 3 hr card if you have your own laptop! The location is has close access to the Metro and grocery and food shops. I agree with other reviewers that you should arrive at the hotel via shuttle or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall impression”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel de Varenne for 6 nights (March 5-11) with my wife and another couple. I liked the place quite a bit: GREAT location (close enough to things in general, but far enough away from hustle, bustle, and noise). Very good bakery 2 doors down, 2 grocery/convenience stores across the street - one operated by an extremely friendly guy who gave my wife a jar of "nutella" when she informed him that we were returning to the states the next day; a bnp paribas bank and atm on the same block (great for bank of america account holders - no atm transaction fees!). The only convenience we really lacked in the hotel was drawer space. Our room (#34, a double with a shower) didn't have any. Our friends stayed in room #44, which did. No complaints at all about the cleanliness, however. Madame Beatrix (who worked the front desk a lot) was really helpful, nice and friendly. All in all, we would stay there again, no question. You won't be disappointed if you go in expecting a good hotel and a good value. You will be disappointed if you go in expecting perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: stormyscarlett
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel de Varenne. We stayed there based on reviews on Trip Advisor. We found the hotel to be nice for a three star hotel. The location is a bit off the beaten path, but we knew that from other reviewers. We found it odd that they allocated just one tiny box of tissues with four tissues inside, for two people for a three day stay???? Some of the staff were very nice, some icily helpful. The hotel was clean, but not spotless. There is no help with bags and the elevator is very tiny, which makes it difficult to transport your own luggage if you have more than a bag per person. We have stayed in many hotels in Paris and overall this is not a bad choice. We didn't leave the hotel with a great feeling, but we wouldn't tell other people not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: DaPanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Varenne for a week at the end of January, having relied on reviews in Tripadvisor. As usual, this site did not let us down. We (2 of us) stayed in a superior room, which was more than ample. We happened to see inside a standard room while walking out, and that room size is above and beyond in size from what you find in Paris at a 3-star hotel. Our room was very clean, but do not expect the George V. Having the fridge in the room was a big plus. Staff is quiet but very helpful. Internet station (for a small fee based on 1 hour or 1/2 hour) also was convenient. The location is excellent as to having close access to the Metro and grocery and food shops. However, if you are carrying a lot of luggage, I do NOT recommend arriving at the hotel using anything other than a shuttle or taxi. The RER stations are a long walk if the weather is cold and some of the streets are narrow. Plus, the Varenne Metro stop is not great for transporting a large suitcase. What you spend in additional money is worth the convenience. Otherwise, if you are travelling light, the Metro or RER is fine. If you absolutely have to use the RER, use a station on the RER-B as your entry/exit point and taxi to/from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: MiriamRein
Reviews.Content: We found this lovely hotel through the tripadvisor, and can only agree with all the good reviews of this lovely little hotel. The location is perfect, an easy walk to the Louvre, the Champs Elysees etc. Equally important is the fact that we felt perfectly safe in the neighborhood : it is close to their National Assembly and there are a number of foreign embassies in neighboring streets, so there are always policemen around. The hotel itself has a nice atmosphere that shows personal care of the management, the room was nice and the bathroom both large and clean. I would certainly want to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: jyoung3381
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Varenne for seven nights in February. We adored the location, clean quiet rooms, the friendly staff and the smell of the fresh bread early in the morning. This Hotel is one of the best examples of "Quality Customer Service" that we have experienced. Our hats are off to all of the staff at the Hotel Varenne.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: puppypuppy
Reviews.Content: I'd love to stay this hotel when I come back to Paris again! I stayed one double bed room alone. It was a very cute decolated room, and very clean. Breakfast in my room was excellent! Staffs are very kind. I attach some photos of a room that I stayed for 2 days. Location is very accessible for any tourist attractions, and around of this hotel is very quiet. When I arrived here, I bought some fruits and pizza in the deli on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “It is all true!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last week. We wer delighted.We read the review before staying here and what a pleasant surprise to find that it was all true!!! Rue Bourgogne is a relativily quiet and pretty steer.Wefound the hotel to be situated in aperfect location for seeing all of the majors sights.The standard of the room was excellent, relaxing, very clean ans rhe bed extremelly comfortable.Breakfast each day was excellent.The hotel owner took peronnaly care of out wellbeeing.

Reviews.Title: “Varenne: Family Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rlemon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Varenne is a bargain. It is located between the Invalides and the Place de Bourbon, and just a half block from the Rodin Museum. During the day, at least one family member is present and unfailingly helpful and courteous. The night staff were always multi-lingual and very competant and eager to please. The rooms were clean and effcient. Baths were refurbished. All public and private spaces were done in excellent taste. Breakfast was good, with fresh baguettes from a local baker. If you want a full breakfast, there are optional items at a modest cost. Each time I visit Paris, I try to stay in a different neighborhood. This time I chose the right bank near the Hotel des Invalides, where you can see the tomb of Napolean, part of the military museum complex. In the opposite direction you can take a rigorous 10 minute walk to the Musee' d'Orsay and the St. Germain neighborhood, with its art galleries and elegant shops. Five minutes from the hotel you are standing on the esplanade above the Seine River. In the hotel, internet service is free if you have your own computer. The building is "hot." Otherwise, be prepared to pay six Euros an hour to buy a card and use their one station. There are no internet cafes in the area, so the options are nil; this was my only complaint. This hotel is among the "Top 10" among TripAdvisor Paris hotels, and the lowest priced of that group. Thanks to TripAdvisor for the tip and this lucky find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: jp_debonair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Varenne over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was quiet, clean, nicely if modestly decorated, and comfortable for a hotel in this price range. Staff was pleasant, if not particularly forthcoming. The immediate area is not booming with restaurants or bars, and we found almost everything closed early (or not open at all on Sunday). Fortunately, it's a short walk to the bustling area surrounding Le Bon Marche. Metro access about 1-1/2 blocks. Note: we took several taxis, and I ended up giving all of them directions to this relatively small street. Know your adjoining streets! All in all pleasant, but if being near the Tour Eiffel is a priority for you I suggest looking in the Rue St. Dominique area (also foodie heaven!).

Reviews.Title: “Homey, Friendly Staff, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bucknut_Girl
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel de Varenne for 9 nights over the Christmas holiday based on Tripadvisor reviews, and we were not disappointed. Those of you who prefer to pay $300-$500 per night for a large chain with spa etc, may not find the homey atmosphere and quiet location your thing, but we loved it. The area is very safe and quiet, but right in the middle of all the fun areas you'll want to go. We took the RER from the airport and transferred to the C-line, so it couldn't have been easier to get to the hotel from the Invalides metro stop. As others have mentioned, there are great bakeries, produce stands, and markets on the street to grab anything you need to stock your hotel fridge. We enjoyed breakfast at the hotel (the traditional French nosh of baked goods and coffee), but anyone who is looking for a big American breakfast will need to get used to the grocery store. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and polite. The hotel owner, Jean Marc Pommier, went so far as to bake us bread one night when all the bakeries on our street were closed over the Christmas holiday! We were a little intimidated because we didn't speak much French, but as long as you practice some general niceties and try a little French, the locals are wonderful. Just note that they work a 35 hour wk, but when they work, they are extremely busy. They like to be efficient and understandably will get irritated if you dawdle and hold up service for other customers (see complaint in earlier review). As for the room, we had a nice size bedroom and bathroom by Europen standards. The beds leave you a little stiff in the morning, but are probably about the best we've had in our visits to Europe. Comments about cleanliness are correct, as this is one of the cleanest places around and recently renovated. (Just keep in mind to dodge the doggie droppings while out walking though.) The rooms are fairly quiet inside, and we had a view of the top of the Eiffel tower and the courtyard which was nice. We have definitely been recommending the Hotel de Varenne to friends and family and hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: brxsof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a small, non-corporate hotel that was quiet, clean, friendly, and located in a safe and convenient area. Hotel De Varenne exceeded our expectations. It is only half a block from the Rodin Museum and only a few doors down from fine breads, pastries, and a small grocery.
