Jean-Marc Pommier's personal welcome when we arrived was appreciated and his staff were friendly and helpful. The room itself was outstanding. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip and will recommend Hotel de Varenne to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering, especially if you're on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: ReturntoDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located about three minutes from Varenne Metro station. Itâ€™s a five minute walk from the AssemblÃ©e Nationale, and about 15 minutes from the Eiffel tower. Due to the presence of several embassies and diplomatic missions on surrounding streets and the proximity of the parliament, there is a very high visibility police presence, and the area is therefore probably relatively safe to walk in at night. We stayed here in November 2005, in a standard double room on the first floor. Despite being on a moderately busy street, there was no audible traffic noise at night. The room was small, but adequate, and well heated. The bathroom was also small but spotlessly clean. The bath had a â€˜telephone setâ€™ shower attachment, but there was no wall fitting on which to attach the shower, so I had to hold it while showering. The double bed was small, and sagged slightly in the middle, making it an adventure to get a good nightâ€™s sleep â€“ neither of us had an unbroken nightâ€™s sleep. The reception was small, but the staff were polite and helpful. A bakery (with incredibly rude staff who scream at you if you donâ€™t respond immediately when they come to serve you!!) almost beside the hotel sells a good selection of fresh bread and pastries, and there was almost always a queue outside â€“ if you are into croissants and Danish pastries to take away, this will make your day! Iâ€™d overlook the staff in favour of the produce. By Paris standards, the hotel was cheap, and despite the shortcomings listed above, Iâ€™d consider staying there again as it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel in a Quiet Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the de Varenne in the end of September. It was a great hotel! The rooms were spotless. The bathrooms were large and even more spotless. Everyone at the reception desk was most helpful and answered all of our questions, even via E-Mail before we got there. It is in a quite neighborhood with some great bakeries and markets on the same street. It is a five minute walk to the Metro. The metro is the best way to travel. It is clean and runs every few minutes. We did a lot of research on trip advisor on finding a hotel, and it paid off! We had breakfast at the hotel twice. The assortment of rolls was nice. We even had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. It was most impressive. Only drawback is the location at night. If you want to walk to a nice restaurant, it is a long walk, There are only a few restaurants closeby. If you are looking for a great hotel in a quiet and safe neighborhood....look no more! Do yourslef a favor, don't bring Cash. Use your ATM's to get Euros. Bring some nice walking shoes too. You will walk a lot.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SMASC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel de Varenne for five nights. We were extremely pleased with the location as well as the quality of the hotel. We opted for one of the larger (more expensive) rooms and felt that it was worth the extra charge. There was a small refrigerator in the room and we purchased breakfast finger foods, drinks, and fruit at the markets near the hotel. When we return to Paris we plan on staying at the Hotel de Varenne. Soulton and Beatrice, both front desk employees, were so helpful and pleasant. They added to the pleasure of our visit in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ralex
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Varenne with my wife and 11 year old son. The room was large enough for an extra twin bed, so it fit our needs nicely. The interior decor is very nice and the bathrooms are large and marble lined. The front desk is a little icy, and one of the gentlemen on the night desk was down right rude at times. But Soultan, the Indian gentleman at night, was very friendly. There are two mini-marts and a patisserie within a few doors of the hotel. I don't recommend paying 10 Euros for a breakfast of croissants and coffee. There are some decent cafes on Rue de Grenelle for lunch or a light dinner. Go to Maubourg or St. Germaine area for a wider assortment of restaurants that stay open later.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Varenne
HotelInfo.Address: 44 Rue de Bourgogne, 75007 Paris, France
